  4776                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4777                                  
  4778                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4779                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4780                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4781                                  
  4782                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4783                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4784                                  		;=============================================================
  4785                                  		;
  4786                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4787                                  		;
  4788                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4789                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4790                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4791                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4792                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4793                                  
  4794                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4795                                  		;=============================================================
  4796                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4797                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4798                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4799                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4800                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4801                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4802                                  		
  4803                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4804                                  		; (from MSLOAD)
  4805                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h, bp = any, ds = previous cs
  4806                                  
  4807                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4808                                  		;cli	; not necessary at this stage
  4809                                  
  4810                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4811                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4812                                  		;push	ax
  4813                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4814                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4815                                  		;pop	ax
  4816                                  	
  4817                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4818                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4819                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4820                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4821                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4822                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4823                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4824                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4825                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4826                                  
  4827                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4828                                  
  4829                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4830                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4831                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4832                                  
  4833 0000162A 2EA3[8815]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4834 0000162E 2E891E[8615]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4835                                  
  4836                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4837                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4838                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4839                                  
  4840 00001633 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4841 00001634 07                      		pop	es
  4842                                  
  4843 00001635 51                      		push	cx ; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4844                                  		;push	di ; *! (not necessary) ; 12/12/2023
  4845                                  
  4846                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4847                                  		; ds <> cs
  4848                                  		; ds = relocated MSLOAD segment, cs = BIOSDATA segment
  4849                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4850                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4851                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4852                                  		; ds = cs
  4853 00001636 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4854 00001638 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4855                                  		; ds = 0
  4856                                  
  4857 0000163A B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4858                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4859                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4860                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4861 0000163C BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4862                                  
  4863                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4864 0000163F FA                      		cli
  4865                                  next_int_:		
  4866 00001640 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4867 00001641 AC                      		lodsb		
  4868                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4869 00001642 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4870 00001643 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4871 00001645 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4872 00001647 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4873 00001649 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4874                                  					; saving address in di
  4875                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4876                                  		;stosw
  4877                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4878                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4879                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4880 0000164B A5                      		movsw
  4881 0000164C A5                      		movsw
  4882                                  
  4883 0000164D 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4884 0000164F E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4885                                  
  4886                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4887                                  		;pop	di  ; *!
  4888                                  		;pop	cx ; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4889                                  
  4890                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4891                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4892                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4893                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4894                                  
  4895                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4896                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4897                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4898                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4899                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4900                                  
  4901                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4902 00001651 C7064C00[4F07]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4903                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4904                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4905 00001657 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4906                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4907 0000165B C7065400[FE07]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4908                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4909                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4910 00001661 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4911                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4912 00001665 C7066400[BE07]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4913                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4914                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4915 0000166B 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4916                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4917                                  
  4918                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4919 0000166F 0E                      		push	cs
  4920 00001670 1F                      		pop	ds
  4921                                  		
  4922 00001671 A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4923 00001674 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4924 00001677 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4925 0000167A A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4926                                  					; ;
  4927 0000167D FB                      		sti
  4928 0000167E CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4929                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4930                                  
  4931                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4932                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4933                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4934                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4935                                  ;
  4936                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4937                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c". so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4938                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4939                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4940                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4941                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4942                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4943                                  
  4944                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4945                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4946                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4947                                  ;
  4948                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4949                                  ; to do anything special.
  4950                                  ;
  4951                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4952                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4953                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4954                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4955                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4956                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4957                                  
  4958                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4959 00001680 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4960                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4961 00001682 7524                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4962                                  
  4963                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4964                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4965                                  ;
  4966                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4967                                  ;
  4968                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4969                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4970                                  
  4971                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4972                                  		; ((cx is already on top of the stack))
  4973                                  		;push	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4974                                  		;push	bx	; not necessary
  4975 00001684 50                      		push	ax
  4976 00001685 52                      		push	dx
  4977                                  		;push	di	; not necessary
  4978 00001686 06                      		push	es
  4979                                  
  4980 00001687 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4981 00001689 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4982 0000168B CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4983                                  					; DL = drive number
  4984                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4985                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4986                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4987 0000168D 7204                    		jc	short _gdskp_error
  4988                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4989                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4990                                  		; ds = cs
  4991 0000168F 8816[2916]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4992                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4993                                  		; 12/12/2023
  4994 00001693 07                      		pop	es
  4995                                  		;pop	di
  4996 00001694 5A                      		pop	dx
  4997 00001695 58                      		pop	ax
  4998                                  		;pop	bx
  4999                                  		; 13/12/2023
  5000                                  		;pop	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  5001 00001696 7210                    		jc	short normalfloppydrv
  5002                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  5003                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  5004                                  
  5005                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5006                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  5007                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  5008                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  5009 00001698 A0[2916]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  5010 0000169B 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  5011 0000169D 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  5012                                  
  5013                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  5014                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5015 0000169F 48                      		dec	ax
  5016 000016A0 EB0A                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  5017                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5018                                  
  5019                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  5020                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5021                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  5022                                  		; 10/12/2023
  5023 000016A2 40                      		inc	ax ; al = 1
  5024 000016A3 A2[9915]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  5025                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  5026                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  5027                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  5028 000016A6 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  5029                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5030                                  
  5031                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  5032 000016A8 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  5033 000016AA D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  5034                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  5035                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  5036                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5037 000016AC 2403                    		and	al, 3
  5038 000016AE 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  5039 000016B0 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  5040                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  5041                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5042                                  		; ds = cs
  5043 000016B1 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  5044                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  5045                                  notsingle:				
  5046 000016B5 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  5047                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  5048                                  					; booted off hard file
  5049                                  		; 13/12/2023
  5050 000016B6 59                      		pop	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  5051                                  
  5052 000016B7 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  5053                                  
  5054                                  ; 16/10/2022
  5055                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  5056                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  5057                                  BRKADR	EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  5058                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt

  5060                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  5061                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  5062                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  5063                                  
  5064                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  5065

  5067 000016BC 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  5068 000016BE 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  5069                                  gothrd:					
  5070                                  		; 07/10/2023			
  5071                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  5072                                  		;			; bios_l, bios_h set.
  5073                                  		;			; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  5074                                  		;			; ch = media byte
  5075

  5078                                  		;cli
  5079                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  5080                                  		;mov	sp, 700h
  5081                                  		;sti
  5082

  5084 000016C1 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  5085 000016C3 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  5086                                  		
  5087                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  5088                                  
  5089 000016C4 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  5090 000016C6 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  5091 000016C8 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  5092 000016CA 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  5093 000016CD 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  5094

  5096                                  		; ds = cs

  5099                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  5100                                  					; get/save model byte

  5107                                  
  5108                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  5109 000016DF BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  5110 000016E2 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  5111                                  		; 21/12/2022

  5113 000016E8 A2[3606]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  5114                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  5115                                  turn_timer_on:				
  5116 000016EB B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  5117 000016ED E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.
  5118                                  					; AKPORT
  5119                                  
  5120                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  5121                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running
  5122                                  ; on one of those, we must inhibit the normal aux port initialization
  5123

  5134 000016FE E650                    		out	50h, al

  5447                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  5455                                  
  5456                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5457                                  ; diskette drives:
  5458                                  ;
  5459                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5460                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5461                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5462                                  ;
  5463                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5464                                  ;
  5465                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5466                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5467                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5468                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5469                                  					
  5470 0000185C 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl

  5479                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5480                                  
  5481                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5482                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5483                                  
  5484                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5485                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5486                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5487                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5488                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5489                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5490                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5491                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5492                                  
  5493 00001866 803E[9915]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1

  5496                                  					; di <-	first bds link

  5498                                  					; di <-	second bds link

  5545                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when
  5546                                  ; they are calculated at the later time. this is just for the diagnostic

  5548                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.

  5920                                  ; if more than 2 diskette drives on the system, then it is necessary to remap
  5921                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  5922                                  ; than two diskette drives
  5923                                  ;
  5924                                  ; new scheme:	if more than 2 disktte drives, first map the bds structure
  5925                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5926                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5927                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5928                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5929                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.

  5942                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5943                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5944                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5945                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5946                                  ;
  5947                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5948                                  ;
  5949                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5950                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5951                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5952                                  ;use to start with.
  5953                                  ;
  5954                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5955                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5956                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5957                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5958                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5959

  6042                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  6043                                  ;
  6044                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  6045                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  6046                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  6047                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  6048                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  6049                                  ; off of it.
  6050                                  ;
  6051                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  6052                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  6053                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  6054                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  6055                                  ; when to install the hook.
  6056                                  
  6057                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  6058                                  ; 02/10/2022

  6367                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization

  6371                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  6372                                  
  6373                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6374                                  ; module name: remap
  6375                                  ;
  6376                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  6377                                  ;
  6378                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  6379                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  6380                                  ;
  6381                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  6382                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  6383                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  6384                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  6385                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  6386                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  6387                                  
  6388                                  ; input:       none
  6389                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  6390                                  ; exit error:  none
  6391                                  ; called from: msinit
  6392                                  ;
  6393                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  6394                                  ;	  found in the system
  6395                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  6396                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  6397                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  6398                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  6399                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  6400                                  ;
  6401                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6402                                  
  6403                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6404                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6405                                  		; 15/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1) IBMBIO.COM
  6406                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2464h)
  6407                                  		; (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSDATA:1D9Eh)
  6408                                  
  6409                                  remap:		; proc near
  6410                                  
  6411                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6412                                  		; ds = cs
  6413                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  6414 00001B19 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]
  6415                                  
  6416                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  6417                                  
  6418                                  drive_loop:
  6419 00001B1D 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6420                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6421 00001B21 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6422 00001B23 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6423                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6424 00001B25 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1 ; 0FFFFh	; last bds?
  6425 00001B28 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6426 00001B2A EB49                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6427                                  
  6428                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6429                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6430                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6431                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6432                                  
  6433                                  fdrv_found:
  6434 00001B2C B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6435                                  fdrv_loop:
  6436 00001B2E 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6437 00001B31 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6438                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6439                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6440                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6441 00001B33 40                      		inc	ax
  6442 00001B34 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  6443 00001B37 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  6444                                  
  6445                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6446                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6447                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6448                                  ; any more.
  6449                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6450                                  
  6451                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6452                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6453 00001B39 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  6454 00001B3D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6455                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6456                                  		;mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6457 00001B3F 8A26[2501]              		mov	ah, [dsktnum]
  6458 00001B43 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6459                                  remap_loop1:
  6460 00001B46 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6461                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6462 00001B48 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6463 00001B4B FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6464 00001B4D FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  6465 00001B4F 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6466                                  
  6467                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6468                                  
  6469                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6470                                  		;mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6471 00001B51 A0[8415]                		mov	al, [drvfat]
  6472 00001B54 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6473 00001B56 721D                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6474                                  		;sub	al, [cs:dsktnum]
  6475 00001B58 2A06[2501]              		sub	al, [dsktnum]	; is it one of the other floppies?
  6476 00001B5C 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6477                                  
  6478                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6479                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6480                                  
  6481 00001B5E 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6482 00001B60 EB04                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6483                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6484                                  
  6485                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6486                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6487                                  
  6488                                  remap_boot_flop:
  6489                                  		;add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6490                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6491 00001B62 0206[7500]              		add	al, [drvmax]
  6492                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6493                                  		;mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6494 00001B66 A2[8415]                		mov	[drvfat], al
  6495 00001B69 FEC0                    		inc	al
  6496 00001B6B 1E                      		push	ds
  6497 00001B6C BF4104                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6498                                  		;mov	di, 544h	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6499                                  		;;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6500 00001B6F 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6501 00001B71 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6502                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6503                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6504 00001B74 1F                      		pop	ds ; ds = cs
  6505                                  rmap_exit:
  6506 00001B75 C3                      		retn
  6507                                  
  6508                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6509                                  
  6510                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6511                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6512                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6513                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6514                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6515                                  ;**************************************************
  6516                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6517                                  ;
  6518                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6519                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6520                                  ;
  6521                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6522                                  ;**************************************************
  6523                                  
  6524                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6525                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6526                                  
  6527                                  getboot:	; proc near
  6528                                  
  6529                                  		; 15/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 
  6530                                  		;	 (Modified MSDOS 6.22) IO.SYS
  6531                                  		; ds = cs
  6532                                  		
  6533                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6534                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6535                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6536                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6537                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6538                                  
  6539                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6540                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6541 00001B76 A1[8F15]                		mov	ax, [init_bootseg]
  6542 00001B79 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6543                                  
  6544                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6545 00001B7B BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6546                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6547                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6548 00001B7E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6549 00001B81 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6550 00001B83 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6551 00001B86 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6552                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6553                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6554                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6555 00001B88 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6556                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6557 00001B8A 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6558                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6559                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6560 00001B91 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6561                                  erret:
  6562 00001B93 F9                      		stc
  6563                                  norm_ret:
  6564 00001B94 C3                      		retn
  6565                                  
  6566                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6567                                  
  6568                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6569                                  
  6570                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6571                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6572                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6573                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6574                                  ;   determine version number
  6575                                  ;
  6576                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6577                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6578                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6579                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6580                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6581                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6582                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6583                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6584                                  
  6585                                  sethard:	; proc near
  6586                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6587                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6588 00001B95 57                      		push	di
  6589 00001B96 53                      		push	bx
  6590                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  6591 00001B97 06                      		push	es
  6592 00001B98 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6593 00001B9B 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6594 00001B9E 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6595                                  					; fnon_removable
  6596 00001BA2 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6597                                  					; ffHardFile
  6598 00001BA6 C606[8C15]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6599 00001BAB 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6600 00001BAD 52                      		push	dx
  6601 00001BAE B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6602 00001BB0 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6603                                  					; DL = drive number
  6604                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6605                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  6607 00001BB2 FEC6                    		inc	dh

  6611 00001BBA 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh

  6613 00001BC0 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6614 00001BC1 E8B2FF                  		call	getboot

  6616 00001BC5 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6617 00001BC7 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6618                                  
  6619                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6620                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6621                                  
  6622                                  act_part:
  6623 00001BCA 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6624 00001BCF 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6625 00001BD1 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6626 00001BD5 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6627 00001BD7 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6628 00001BDB 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6629 00001BDD 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6630 00001BE1 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6631                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  6632 00001BE3 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6633                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  6634 00001BE5 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6635 00001BE7 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6636                                  no_act:					
  6637 00001BE9 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6638 00001BEC 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6639                                  					; last entry done?
  6640 00001BF0 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6641 00001BF2 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6642                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6643                                  
  6644                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6645                                  
  6646                                  get_primary:
  6647 00001BF5 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6648 00001BFA 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6649                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6650 00001BFC 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6651 00001C00 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6652 00001C02 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6653 00001C06 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6654 00001C08 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6655 00001C0C 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6656                                  got_prim:
  6657 00001C0E 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6658 00001C10 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6659 00001C12 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6660                                  not_prim:
  6661 00001C14 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6662 00001C17 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6663 00001C1B 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6664                                  setret:					
  6665 00001C1D F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6666 00001C1E E99A02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6667                                  
  6668                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6669                                  
  6670                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6671                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6672                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6673                                  ;
  6674                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6675                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6676                                  ;  without change.
  6677                                  ;
  6678                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6679                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6680                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6681                                  
  6682                                  set2:		
  6683                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6684                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6685 00001C21 8816[9115]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6686                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6687                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6688 00001C25 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6689 00001C29 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6690                                  
  6691                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6692                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6693                                  
  6694 00001C2D 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6695 00001C30 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6696 00001C33 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6697 00001C37 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6698 00001C3B 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6699 00001C3D 800E[8C15]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6700                                  okdrive:
  6701 00001C42 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6702 00001C46 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6703                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6704 00001C49 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6705 00001C4D 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6706 00001C50 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6707 00001C54 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6708 00001C58 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6709 00001C5B 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6710                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6711 00001C5E 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6712 00001C61 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6713 00001C63 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6714 00001C66 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6715                                  okdrive_1:
  6716 00001C68 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6717 00001C6B 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6718 00001C6E 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6719                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6720 00001C70 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6721 00001C73 50                      		push	ax
  6722 00001C74 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6723 00001C76 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6724 00001C78 F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6725                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6726                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6727                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6728                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6729 00001C7A A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  6730 00001C7D 58                      		pop	ax
  6731 00001C7E F7F3                    		div	bx
  6732 00001C80 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6733 00001C82 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6734 00001C84 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6735 00001C86 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6736 00001C89 50                      		push	ax
  6737 00001C8A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6738                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6739 00001C8C A1[2105]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  6740 00001C8F F7F3                    		div	bx
  6741                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6742 00001C91 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  6743 00001C94 58                      		pop	ax
  6744 00001C95 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6745                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6746 00001C97 833E[2105]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  6747                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6748 00001C9C 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6749 00001C9E 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6750 00001CA1 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6751                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6752                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6753                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6754                                  okdrive_2:
  6755                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6756                                  ; dl is head.
  6757                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6758                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6759                                  
  6760                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6761                                  
  6762 00001CA3 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6763                                  					; check for mini disk

  6765 00001CA9 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6766                                  					; set the physical track number

  6768                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6769                                  				
  6770 00001CAC D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  6771 00001CAE D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6772 00001CB0 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  6773 00001CB3 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  6774 00001CB5 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch iscylinder (low 8 bits)
  6775                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6776 00001CB7 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6777                                  		
  6778                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)

  6780                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6781                                  
  6782                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6783                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6784                                  ; dh is head
  6785                                  ; dl is drive
  6786                                  
  6787                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6788                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6789                                  
  6790                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6791                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6792                                  
  6793 00001CBD 0E                      		push	cs
  6794 00001CBE 07                      		pop	es
  6795 00001CBF BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6796                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6797                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6798 00001CC2 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6799 00001CC5 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6800                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6801                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6802                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6803                                  
  6804                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6805                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6806                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6807                                  
  6808                                  		; 11/08/2023
  6809                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  6810                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6811 00001CC7 53                      		push	bx
  6812 00001CC8 50                      		push	ax
  6813                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6814                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  6815 00001CC9 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  6816                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6817 00001CCC 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6818 00001CCE 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  6819                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6820 00001CD1 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6821 00001CD3 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  6822                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6823 00001CD7 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  6824                                  check_1_ok:
  6825                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6826 00001CD9 BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6827                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6828                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record
  6829                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6830 00001CDC 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 12/08/2023 
  6831                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6832 00001CDF 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6833 00001CE1 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6834 00001CE3 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  6835                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6836 00001CE5 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  6837 00001CE9 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6838                                  
  6839                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6840 00001CEB 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  6841                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  6842                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  6843                                  					; a power of 2
  6844                                  					;
  6845                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6846                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6847 00001CEE 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it zero?
  6848 00001CF0 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6849                                  
  6850                                  ck_power_of_two:
  6851 00001CF2 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift until first bit emerges
  6852 00001CF4 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6853 00001CF6 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6854                                  
  6855                                  invalid_boot_record:
  6856 00001CF8 58                      		pop	ax
  6857 00001CF9 5B                      		pop	bx
  6858 00001CFA E90901                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6859                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6860                                  
  6861                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6862                                  	; 12/08/2023
  6863                                  setret_brdg:
  6864 00001CFD E91DFF                  		jmp	setret

  6866                                  
  6867                                  unknown3_0_j:

  6900                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6901

  6904                                  
  6905                                  ; see if it is an os2 signature

  6909 00001D15 817F08302E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '0.'

  6919 00001D25 E9DE00                  		jmp	unknown

  6921                                  
  6922                                  ; no os2 signature, this is to check for real dos versions
  6923                                  
  6924                                  no_os2:
  6925                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6926                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6927 00001D28 817F08332E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '3.'			
  6928                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '3.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6929                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E33h ; '3.'
  6930 00001D2D 72D1                    		jb	short unknown3_0_j ; must be 2.1 boot record.
  6931                                  					; do not trust it, but still legal.
  6932 00001D2F 7506                    		jnz	short copybpb	; honor	os2 boot record
  6933                                  					; or dos 4.0 version
  6934 00001D31 807F0A31                		cmp	byte [bx+10], '1' ; 12/08/2023
  6935                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+10], '1'
  6936                                  		;;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 31h ; '1'
  6937 00001D35 72C9                    		jb	short unknown3_0_j ; if version >= 3.1, then o.k.
  6938                                  copybpb:
  6939                                  
  6940                                  ; 03/10/2022
  6941                                  
  6942                                  ; we have a valid boot sector. use the bpb in it to build the
  6943                                  ; bpb in bios. it is assumed that only
  6944                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER
  6945                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_ROOTENTRIES, and
  6946                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERFAT
  6947                                  ; need to be set (all other values in already). fbigfat is also set.
  6948                                  
  6949                                  ; if it is non fat based system, then just copy the bpb from the boot sector
  6950                                  ; into the bpb in bds table, and also set the boot serial number, volume id,
  6951                                  ; and system id according to the boot record.
  6952                                  ; for the non_fat system, don't need to set the other value. so just do goodret.
  6953                                  
  6954                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6955                                  		; (number of FATs optimization)
  6956 00001D37 BE[5901]                		mov	si, disksector+11 ; disksector+0Bh
  6957                                  		;;mov	cl, [cs:disksector+10h] ; Number of FATs (may be 2 or 1)
  6958                                  		;mov	cl, [cs:si+05h]
  6959                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6960                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6961 00001D3A 8A4C05                  		mov	cl, [si+05h] ; number of FATs

  7319                                  
  7320                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is guaranteed
  7321                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  7322                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  7323                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  7324                                  
  7325 00001E43 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; 12 bit fat (FAT12 fs)
  7326 00001E45 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch

  7329 00001E4A D3EB                    		shr	bx, cl		; bx = 1+(bpb->maxsec+BDS.secperclus-1)/
  7330 00001E4C 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus
  7331 00001E4D 80E3FE                  		and	bl, 0FEh	; bx &= ~1; (=number of clusters)
  7332 00001E50 89DE                    		mov	si, bx

  7334 00001E54 01F3                    		add	bx, si		; number of FAT bytes ; 08/08/2023
  7335 00001E56 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  7336 00001E5A D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)
  7337 00001E5C 887D11                  		mov	[di+11h], bh	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  7338                                  					; save number of fat sectors
  7339 00001E5F EB35                    		jmp	short massage_bpb

  7343

  7372                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  7373                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
