 10077                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10078                                  
 10079                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10080                                  ; gettime reads date and time
 10081                                  ; and returns the following information:
 10082                                  ;
 10083                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
 10084                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
 10085                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
 10086                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
 10087                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
 10088                                  ;
 10089                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
 10090                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
 10091                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
 10092                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10093                                  
 10094                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
 10095 000004CE E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
 10096 000004D1 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
 10097                                  
 10098                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
 10099                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
 10100                                  ;
 10101                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
 10102                                  ;	       ----------------
 10103                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
 10104                                  ;
 10105                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
 10106                                  ;
 10107                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
 10108                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
 10109                                  ;		1,193,180
 10110                                  ;
 10111                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
 10112                                  ;
 10113                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
 10114                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
 10115                                  ;		59,659
 10116                                  ;
 10117                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
 10118                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
 10119                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
 10120                                  ;
 10121                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
 10122                                  ; multiply by 5
 10123                                  
 10124 000004D5 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 10125 000004D7 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
 10126                                  					; multiply by 5
 10127 000004D9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 10128 000004DB D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
 10129 000004DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 10130 000004DF D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
 10131 000004E1 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
 10132 000004E3 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
 10133 000004E5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
 10134                                  
 10135                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
 10136                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
 10137                                  
 10138 000004E6 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
 10139 000004E9 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
 10140                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
 10141                                  
 10142                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 10143                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
 10144 000004EB 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
 10145 000004EC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
 10146 000004EE F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
 10147                                  
 10148                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
 10149                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
 10150                                  
 10151 000004F0 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
 10152 000004F2 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
 10153                                  
 10154                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
 10155                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
 10156                                  
 10157 000004F5 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10158 000004F7 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
 10159 000004FA 7203                    		jb	short noadj
 10160 000004FC 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
 10161                                  noadj:					
 10162 000004FF F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
 10163 00000500 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
 10164                                  
 10165                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
 10166                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
 10167                                  
 10168 00000502 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
 10169 00000504 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
 10170 00000506 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
 10171 00000508 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
 10172 0000050B F7F1                    		div	cx
 10173 0000050D 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
 10174 0000050F F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
 10175 00000511 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
 10176                                  
 10177                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
 10178                                  
 10179                                  		; 08/08/2023
 10180                                  		;push	ax
 10181                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
 10182 00000513 96                      		xchg	ax, si
 10183 00000514 AB                      		stosw
 10184                                  		;pop	ax
 10185 00000515 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
 10186 00000516 AB                      		stosw
 10187 00000517 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
 10188 00000519 AB                      		stosw
 10189 0000051A F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
 10190                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
 10191                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
 10192                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
 10193                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
 10194 0000051B C3                      		retn
 10195                                  
 10196                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10197                                  
 10198                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10199                                  
 10200                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10201                                  ;
 10202                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
 10203                                  ;
 10204                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
 10205                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
 10206                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
 10207                                  ;
 10208                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
 10209                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
 10210                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
 10211                                  ;			else
 10212                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
 10213                                  ;		}
 10214                                  ;
 10215                                  ; USES : AX
 10216                                  ;
 10217                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
 10218                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
 10219                                  ;
 10220                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10221                                  
 10222                                  		; 17/10/2022
 10223                                  GetTickCnt:	
 10224 0000051C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 10225 0000051E CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
 10226                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
 10227                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
 10228                                  					; midnight
 10229                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
 10230 00000520 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
 10231 00000525 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
 10232 00000527 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
 10233                                  					; and not flag
 10234 00000529 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
 10235 0000052D C3                      		retn
 10236                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10237                                  
 10238                                  inc_case:				
 10239 0000052E 08C0                    		or	al, al
 10240 00000530 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
 10241 00000532 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
 10242                                  no_rollover:				
 10243 00000536 C3                      		retn
 10244

 10272                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 10273                                  ;	disk interface routines
 10274                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 10275                                  
 10276                                  ; device attribute bits:
 10277                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
 10278                                  
 10279                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
 10280                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
 10281                                  
 10282                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
 10283                                  
 10284                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
 10285                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
 10286                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
 10287                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
 10288                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
 10289                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
 10290                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
 10291                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
 10292                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
 10293                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
 10294                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
 10295                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
 10296                                  ; we reset the counter.
 10297                                  
 10298                                  accessmax	equ	5
 10299                                  
 10300                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
 10301                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
 10302                                  ;
 10303                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
 10304                                  ;   if it is 0, then
 10305                                  ;	set slow = 15
 10306                                  ;   else
 10307                                  ;	set slow = value
 10308                                  ;   ...
 10309                                  ;*********************************************
 10310                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
 10311                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
 10312                                  ;*	 use slow
 10313                                  ;*   else
 10314                                  ;*	 use fast
 10315                                  ;*********************************************
 10316                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
 10317                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
 10318                                  ;	use slow
 10319                                  ;   else
 10320                                  ;	use fast
 10321                                  ;   ...
 10322                                  ;   restore current head settle value

 10329                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.

 10412                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10413                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
 10414                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
 10415                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
 10416                                  ;
 10417                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
 10418                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10419                                  
 10420                                  SetDrive:	
 10421                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
 10422 0000056D C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
 10423                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
 10424 00000571 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
 10425 00000575 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
 10426 00000577 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
 10427 0000057A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 10428 0000057D 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
 10429 0000057F F9                      		stc
 10430                                  X_SetDrv:				
 10431 00000580 C3                      		retn
 10432                                  
 10433                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10434                                  
 10435                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10436                                  
 10437                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 10438                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
 10439                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
 10440                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
 10441                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
 10442                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 10443                                  
 10444                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
 10445 00000581 E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
 10446 00000584 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
 10447 00000587 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10448                                  					; fchanged_by_format
 10449 0000058C 7415                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
 10450                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10451 0000058E 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
 10452                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10453                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
 10454 00000593 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
 10455                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
 10456 00000598 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10457                                  					; fnon_removable
 10458 0000059D 740B                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
 10459                                  		;mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
 10460                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10461 0000059F F7DE                    		neg	si		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05E0h
 10462 000005A1 EB2B                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
 10463                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10464                                  
 10465                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
 10466                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
 10467 000005A3 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10468 000005A8 7524                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 10469                                  wehaveafloppy:				
 10470                                  		;xor	si, si ; 0	; Presume "I don't know"
 10471                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10472 000005AA 4E                      		dec	si ; 0 		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05EBh
 10473                                  
 10474                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
 10475                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
 10476                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
 10477                                  
 10478 000005AB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
 10479 000005B0 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
 10480 000005B2 E88112                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
 10481 000005B5 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
 10482 000005B7 E8D113                  		call	haschange
 10483 000005BA 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 10484                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
 10485                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
 10486                                  			
 10487 000005BC BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
 10488 000005BF A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
 10489 000005C2 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10490                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
 10491 000005C6 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
 10492 000005C8 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
 10493 000005CB EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
 10494                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10495                                  
 10496                                  Media_Unk:				
 10497 000005CD 4E                      		dec	si		; ; Return "I don't know"
 10498                                  
 10499                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
 10500                                  		; Clean up the left overs
 10501                                  Media_Done:	
 10502                                  		; 19/10/2022			
 10503 000005CE 06                      		push	es
 10504 000005CF C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
 10505 000005D3 2689770E                		mov	[es:bx+0Eh], si	; [es:bx+trans]
 10506 000005D7 07                      		pop	es
 10507 000005D8 09F6                    		or	si, si
 10508 000005DA 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
 10509 000005DC 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 10510 000005E1 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
 10511 000005E3 E83713                  		call	media_set_vid
 10512                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:

 10514                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
 10515                                  ret_carry_clear:

 10517 000005EC C3                      		retn
 10518                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10519                                  
 10520                                  err_exitj:				
 10521 000005ED E87806                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
 10522                                  ret81:					
 10523 000005F0 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
 10524 000005F2 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
 10525                                  
 10526                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10527                                  
 10528                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10529                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 10530                                  ; drive.
 10531                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 10532                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 10533                                  ; returns in si:
 10534                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 10535                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 10536                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 10537                                  ;
 10538                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 10539                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10540                                  
 10541                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10542                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 10543 000005F3 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 10544 000005F6 E823FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 10545 000005F9 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 10546                                  					; get stored time
 10547 000005FD 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 10548 000005FF 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 10549 00000603 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 10550                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10551                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 10552                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 10553 00000605 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 10554 00000607 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 10555 00000609 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 10556                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10557                                  		;inc	al
 10558                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 10559                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 10560                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10561                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 10562                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 10563                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 10564                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10565                                  		;dec	al
 10566                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 10567                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10568 0000060B 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 10569 00000610 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 10570 00000612 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10571 00000616 C3                      		retn
 10572                                  
 10573                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10574                                  
 10575                                  timepassed:
 10576 00000617 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
 10577                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 10578 0000061A 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 10579                                  
 10580                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
 10581                                  timecheck_unk:				
 10582 0000061C 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
 10583                                  timecheck_ret:
 10584                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10585                                  		;mov	[accesscount], al
 10586 0000061D C3                      		retn
 10587                                  
 10588                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10589                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10590                                  Err_Exitj2:
 10591 0000061E EBCD                    		jmp	short err_exitj
 10592                                  
 10593                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10594                                  
 10595                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10596                                  
 10597                                  ; ==========================================================================
 10598                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.
 10599                                  ; ==========================================================================
 10600                                  
 10601                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10602                                  get_bpb:				; 2C7h:592h = 70h:2B02h
 10603 00000620 268A25                  		mov	ah, [es:di]	; get fat id byte read by dos
 10604 00000623 E847FF                  		call	SetDrive	; get the correct bds for the drive
 10605 00000626 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10606                                  					; fnon_removable
 10607 0000062B 7523                    		jnz	short already_gotbpb ; no need to build	for fixed disks
 10608                                  
 10609                                  		; let's set the default value for volid,vol_serial,
 10610                                  		; filesys_id in bds table
 10611                                  
 10612 0000062D E83700                  		call	clear_ids
 10613                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	1 ; indicate to	set system id in bds
 10614 00000630 C606[0205]01            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 1
 10615 00000635 E85B00                  		call	GetBp		; build	a bpb if necessary
 10616 00000638 72B6                    		jb	short ret81
 10617                                  		;cmp	ds:set_id_flag,	2 ; already, volume_label set from boot
 10618 0000063A 803E[0205]02            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 2
 10619                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 ; record to bds table?
 10620 0000063F C606[0205]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
 10621 00000644 740A                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; do not set it again from	root dir
 10622                                  					; otherwise, conventional boot record
 10623                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	; do we	have changeline	support?
 10624 00000646 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 10625 0000064B 7403                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; brif not
 10626 0000064D E84113                  		call	set_volume_id
 10627                                  already_gotbpb:				
 10628 00000650 83C706                  		add	di, 6		; BDS.BPB
 10629                                  					; return the bpb from the current bds
 10630                                  
 10631                                  ;		 fall into setptrsav, es:di -> result
 10632

 10634                                  
 10635                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10636                                  
 10637                                  ; ==========================================================================
 10638                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
 10639                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
 10640                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
 10641                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
 10642                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data. 
 10643                                  ;NB: It is fine to corrupt cx because this is not a return value and anyway
 10644                                  ;this returns to Chardev_entry (msbio1.asm) where all registers are 
 10645                                  ;restored before returning to the caller.
 10646                                  ; ==========================================================================

 10649                                  SetPtrSav:	; return point for dsk_init				
 10650 00000653 8CC1                    		mov	cx, es		; save es

 10653 00000659 2688670D                		mov	[es:bx+0Dh], ah	; [es:bx+media]
 10654 0000065D 26897F12                		mov	[es:bx+12h], di	; [es:bx+count]

 10661                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10662                                  
 10663                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10664                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 10665                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 10666                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 10667                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 10668                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 10669                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 10670                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
 10671                                  ;
 10672                                  ;	trashes si, cx
 10673                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10674                                  
 10675                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 10676                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 10677                                  
 10678                                  ; 11/09/2023
 10679                                  ; 14/08/2023
 10680                                  ;BDS.fatsiz equ 1Fh
 10681                                  
 10682                                  clear_ids:
 10683                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)
 10684 00000667 268A451F                		mov	al, [es:di+1Fh] ; mov al,[es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
 10685                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
 10686                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)
 10687 0000066B 57                      		push	di
 10688 0000066C 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx		; no serial number
 10689 0000066E 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10690 00000672 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10691                                  
 10692                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
 10693                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
 10694                                  		; merging them... jgl
 10695                                  
 10696                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10697                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10698 00000676 B10B                    		mov	cl, 11 ; cx = 11		
 10699                                  
 10700                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
 10701 00000678 BE[1505]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
 10702 0000067B 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10703 0000067E F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10704                                  		
 10705                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 10706                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 10707                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 10708                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 10709                                  
 10710                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 10711                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 10712                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 10713                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 10714                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 10715                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 10716                                  			;
 10717                                  			; Correct Code:
 10718                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 10719                                  			; 11/09/2023
 10720                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 10721                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 10722                                  			;
 10723                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 10724                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 10725                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 10726                                  			;
 10727                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 10728                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 10729                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 10730                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 10731                                  
 10732 00000680 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 10733                                  		
 10734                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"
 10735 00000682 BE[0C05]                		mov	si, fat_16_id	; 19/10/2022
 10736 00000685 7503                    		jnz	short ci_bigfat
 10737                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_12_id ; "FAT12	"
 10738 00000687 BE[0305]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022
 10739                                  ci_bigfat:				
 10740                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10741                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10742 0000068A B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8 
 10743 0000068C 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10744                                  					; filesys_id field
 10745 0000068F F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10746 00000691 5F                      		pop	di		; restore bds pointer
 10747 00000692 C3                      		retn

 10752                                  
 10753                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10754                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10755                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10756                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10757                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10758                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10759                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10760                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10761                                  ;
 10762                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10763                                  ;
 10764                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10765                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10766                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10767                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10768                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10769                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10770                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10771                                  ;
 10772                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10773                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10774                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10775                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10776                                  
 10777                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 10778                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
 10779 00000693 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
 10780 00000698 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
 10781 0000069A E99A00                  		jmp	getret_exit

 10790                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
 10791                                  		; have a valid boot sector.

 10942                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10943                                  
 10944                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10945                                  
 10946                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10947                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10948                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10949                                  ;
 10950                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10951                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10952                                  
 10953                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10954                                  
 10955                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 10956                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 10957                                  
 10958                                  readbootsec:	
 10959 0000074C B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10960 0000074E B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10961 00000751 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10962 00000754 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10963 00000756 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10964                                  
 10965                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10966                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10967                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10968                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10969                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10970                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10971                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10972                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10973                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10974                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10975                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10976                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10977                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10978                                  		; informations
 10979                                  
 10980                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10981                                  
 10982                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10983                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10984                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10985                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10986                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10987                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10988                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10989                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10990                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10991                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10992                                  
 10993                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10994 00000758 A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10995 0000075B 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10996 0000075D 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10997                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10998 0000075F 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10999 00000761 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 11000                                  					; no need for nop
 11001 00000763 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 11002 00000765 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 11003 00000767 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 11004 0000076C 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 11005                                  
 11006                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 11007                                  ;
 11008                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 11009                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 11010                                  ;;
 11011                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 11012                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 11013                                  ;;
 11014                                  ;;check_signature:
 11015                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 11016                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 11017                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 11018                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 11019                                  
 11020                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 11021                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 11022                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 11023                                  
 11024                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11025                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 11026 0000076E A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 11027                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 11028 00000771 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 11029 00000772 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 11030 00000774 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 11031 00000776 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 11032 00000777 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 11033                                  
 11034                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 11035                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 11036                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 11037                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 11038                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 11039                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 11040                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 11041                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 11042                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 11043                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 11044                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 11045                                  
 11046                                  checksinglesided:
 11047                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 11048                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11049                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 11050 00000779 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 11051 0000077B 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 11052 0000077D A801                    		test	al, 1
 11053 0000077F 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 11054 00000781 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 11055 00000787 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 11056 00000789 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 11057 0000078E 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 11058                                  
 11059                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 11060                                  
 11061                                  mustbeearlier:				
 11062 00000790 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 11063                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 11064 00000795 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 11065                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11066                                  
 11067                                  invalidbootsec:				
 11068 00000797 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 11069                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11070                                  movbpb_ret:
 11071                                  gooddsk:				
 11072 00000798 F8                      		clc
 11073                                  err_ret:
 11074 00000799 C3                      		retn

 11079                                  		;retn

 11081                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11082                                  
 11083                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11084                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11085                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 11086                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 11087                                  ;
 11088                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 11089                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 11090                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 11091                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 11092                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 11093                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 11094                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11095                                  
 11096                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11097                                  
 11098                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11099                                  movbpb:	
 11100 0000079A 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 11101                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 11102                                  					; sectors per unit
 11103 0000079E 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 11104                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 11105                                  					; number of directory entries
 11106 000007A2 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 11107                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 11108                                  					; size of drive
 11109 000007A6 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 11110                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 11111                                  					; media	descriptor
 11112 000007AA A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 11113                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 11114                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 11115 000007AD 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 11116                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 11117                                  					; sectors per track
 11118 000007B1 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 11119                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 11120                                  					; number of heads
 11121 000007B5 803E[0205]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 11122 000007BA 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 11123 000007BC E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 11124 000007BF 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 11125 000007C1 C606[0205]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 11126                                  movbpb_conv:				
 11127 000007C6 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 11128 000007CB 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 11129 000007CD E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 11130                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11131                                  		; cf = 0
 11132                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 11133                                  		;clc
 11134 000007D0 C3                      		retn
 11135                                  
 11136                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11137                                  
 11138                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 11139                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 11140                                  ;by es:di.
 11141                                  
 11142                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 11143                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 11144                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 11145                                  ;      the boot record information.
 11146                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 11147                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 11148                                  
 11149                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11150                                  mov_media_ids:		
 11151 000007D1 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 11152                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 11153                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 11154 000007D6 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 11155 000007D8 51                      		push	cx
 11156 000007D9 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 11157                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]

 11194                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 11195                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 11196                                  ; input : es:di -> bds

 11214                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11215                                  
 11216                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11217                                  
 11218                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11219                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 11220                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 11221                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 11222                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 11223                                  ;		dh has head
 11224                                  ;		es:di has bds
 11225                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 11226                                  ;
 11227                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 11228                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 11229                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 11230                                  ;
 11231                                  ;		carry set
 11232                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 11233                                  ;
 11234                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 11235                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11236                                  
 11237                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11238                                  
 11239                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11240                                  read_sector:	
 11241 00000813 55                      		push	bp
 11242 00000814 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 11243 00000817 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 11244 0000081B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 11245                                  rd_ret:					
 11246 0000081E 06                      		push	es
 11247 0000081F 1E                      		push	ds
 11248 00000820 07                      		pop	es
 11249 00000821 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 11250 00000824 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 11251                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 11252                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 11253                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 11254 00000826 07                      		pop	es
 11255 00000827 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 11256                                  rd_rty:					
 11257 00000829 E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 11258 0000082C 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 11259 0000082E 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 11260                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11261                                  					; fnon_removable
 11262 00000833 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 11263 00000835 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 11264 0000083A 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 11265 0000083C 50                      		push	ax
 11266 0000083D 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 11267 0000083E C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 11268                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 11269                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 11270                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 11271                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11272 00000842 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 11273 00000844 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 11274                                  		; 
 11275 00000847 1F                      		pop	ds
 11276 00000848 A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 11277 0000084B 58                      		pop	ax
 11278                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 11279 0000084C 06                      		push	es
 11280 0000084D 1E                      		push	ds
 11281 0000084E 07                      		pop	es
 11282 0000084F B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 11283 00000852 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 11284                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 11285                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 11286                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 11287 00000854 07                      		pop	es
 11288 00000855 9C                      		pushf
 11289 00000856 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 11290 0000085B 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 11291 0000085D 50                      		push	ax
 11292 0000085E A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 11293 00000861 1E                      		push	ds
 11294 00000862 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 11295 00000866 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 11296 00000869 1F                      		pop	ds
 11297 0000086A 58                      		pop	ax
 11298                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 11299 0000086B 9D                      		popf
 11300 0000086C 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 11301 0000086E EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 11302                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11303                                  
 11304                                  err_rd_ret:				
 11305 00000870 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 11306                                  					; return error
 11307 00000872 F9                      		stc
 11308                                  
 11309                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 11310                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 11311                                  
 11312                                  okret2:					
 11313 00000873 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk

 11348                                  exitjx:

 11350                                  		; cf = 0
 11351                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 11412                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

 11414                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11415                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11416                                  
 11417                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 11418                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 11419                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 11420                                  
 11421                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 11422                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 11423                                  ;
 11424                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 11425                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 11426                                  
 11427                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11428                                  checksingle:		
 11429 000008D5 50                      		push	ax
 11430 000008D6 53                      		push	bx
 11431 000008D7 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11432                                  
 11433                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 11434                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 11435                                  
 11436 000008DB F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 11437 000008DE 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 11438 000008E0 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 11439                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 11440 000008E3 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 11441                                  
 11442                                  
 11443                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 11444                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 11445                                  
 11446 000008E5 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 11447                                  					; get physical drive number
 11448 000008E9 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 11449 000008EA 57                      		push	di
 11450 000008EB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 11451                                  scan_list:				
 11452 000008EF 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 11453 000008F3 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 11454 000008F5 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 11455 000008F7 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 11456 000008FB 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 11457 000008FD 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 11458 00000901 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 11459 00000902 07                      		pop	es
 11460 00000903 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 11461                                  
 11462                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 11463                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 11464                                  ; in this case.
 11465 00000907 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 11466 0000090C 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 11467                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 11468 0000090E 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 11469 00000913 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 11470 00000915 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 11471                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 11472                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 11473 00000919 06                      		push	es
 11474 0000091A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 11475 0000091E 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 11476                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 11477                                  					; set up sdsb
 11478 00000922 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 11479 00000923 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 11480                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11481                                  
 11482                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 11483                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 11484                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 11485                                  
 11486                                  not_fsetowner:				
 11487 00000925 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 11488 0000092A 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 11489 0000092C 50                      		push	ax
 11490 0000092D 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 11491 00000931 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 11492 00000933 06                      		push	es
 11493 00000934 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 11494 00000938 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 11495                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 11496                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 11497 0000093D 07                      		pop	es
 11498 0000093E 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 11499 00000940 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 11500 00000941 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 11501                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 11502 00000943 E8690E                  		call	swpdsk
 11503 00000946 EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 11504                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11505                                  
 11506                                  scan_skip:	
 11507 00000948 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 11508                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 11509                                  					; go to	next bds
 11510 0000094B 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 11511 0000094E 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 11512 00000950 F9                      		stc
 11513 00000951 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 11514 00000952 07                      		pop	es

 11537                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11538                                  
 11539                                  ; 15/10/52022
 11540                                  
 11541                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11542                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 11543                                  ;
 11544                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 11545                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 11546                                  ;	cx = sector count
 11547                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 11548                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 11549                                  ;	ds = cs
 11550                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 11551                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 11552                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 11553                                  ;
 11554                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 11555                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 11556                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11557                                  
 11558                                  diskrd:	
 11559                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 11560                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11561 0000095E C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 11562                                  
 11563                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11564                                  
 11565                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11566                                  diskio:
 11567 00000963 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 11568 00000965 8C06[2F05]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 11569 00000969 E801FC                  		call	SetDrive
 11570 0000096C 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 11571 00000970 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 11572                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 11573 00000973 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 11574                                  
 11575                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 11576                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 11577                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 11578                                  
 11579 00000975 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 11580                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 11581                                  					; unformatted_media
 11582 0000097A 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 11583 0000097C 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 11584 00000980 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 11585                                  
 11586                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 11587                                  
 11588 00000984 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 11589 00000986 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 11590 00000988 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 11591                                  		;adc	si, 0
 11592                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 11593 0000098A D1D6                    		rcl	si, 1
 11594 0000098C 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11595                                  					; 32 bit sector ?
 11596 00000991 740C                    		jz	short sanity32
 11597                                  		;cmp	si, 0
 11598                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11599 00000993 09F6                    		or	si, si
 11600 00000995 75BF                    		jnz	short baddrive
 11601 00000997 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11602 0000099B 77B9                    		ja	short baddrive
 11603 0000099D EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 11604                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11605                                  
 11606                                  sanity32:

 12019                                  
 12020                                  ; check the error returned in ah to see if it is a soft ecc error.
 12021                                  ; if it is not we needn't do anything special. if it is a soft
