 13568                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13569                                  ;	get media id
 13570                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13571                                  ;
 13572                                  ; FUNCTION: get the volume label,the system id and the serial number from
 13573                                  ;	    the media that has the extended boot record.
 13574                                  ;	    for the conventional media,this routine will return "unknown
 13575                                  ;	    media type" error to dos.
 13576                                  ;
 13577                                  ; INPUT :   ES:di -> bds table for this drive.
 13578                                  ;
 13579                                  ; OUTPUT:   the request packet filled with the information,if not carry.
 13580                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 13581                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 13582                                  ;	    register DS,DX,AX,CX,DI,SI destroyed.
 13583                                  ;
 13584                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 13585                                  ;	BootIo:NEAR
 13586                                  ;
 13587                                  ; LOGIC:
 13588                                  ;	to recognize the extended boot record,this logic will actually
 13589                                  ;	access the boot sector even if it is a hard disk.
 13590                                  ;	note:the valid extended bpb is recognized by looking at the mediabyte
 13591                                  ;	field of bpb and the extended boot signature.
 13592                                  ;
 13593                                  ; {
 13594                                  ;	get logical drive number from bds table;
 13595                                  ;	rFlag = read operation;
 13596                                  ;	BootIo;		 /*get the media boot record into the buffer
 13597                                  ;	if (no error) then
 13598                                  ;	     if (extended boot record) then
 13599                                  ;		{ set volume label,volume serial number and system id
 13600                                  ;		  of the request packet to those of the boot record;
 13601                                  ;		};
 13602                                  ;	     else		  /*not an extended bpb */
 13603                                  ;		{ set register al to "unknown media.." error code;
 13604                                  ;		  set carry bit;
 13605                                  ;		};
 13606                                  ;	else
 13607                                  ;	     ret;	/*already error code is set in the register al
 13608                                  ;
 13609                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13610                                  
 13611                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL equ 4
 13612                                  ;;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 13613                                  ;;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 13614                                  
 13615                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13616                                  GetMediaId:
 13617 000011E5 E89F00                  		call	ChangeLineChk
 13618 000011E8 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet] ; Logical drive number
 13619 000011EC C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2	; Read operation
 13620 000011F1 E87B00                  		call	BootIo		; Read boot sector into	DiskSector
 13621 000011F4 7224                    		jb	short IOCtl_If1
 13622                                  					; Valid? (0F0h-0FFh?)
 13623 000011F6 803E[6301]F0            		cmp	byte [disksector+15h], 0F0h
 13624                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 13625 000011FB 721A                    		jb	short IOCtl_If2	; brif not valid (0F0h - 0FFh)
 13626                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13627 000011FD BE[7401]                		mov	si, disksector+26h
 13628 00001200 803C29                  		cmp	byte [si], 29h
 13629                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h ; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG]
 13630                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 13631 00001203 7512                    		jnz	short IOCtl_If2	; not extended boot record
 13632 00001205 C43E[1200]              		les	di, [ptrsav]	; es:di	points to request header
 13633 00001209 26C47F13                		les	di, [es:bx+19]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13634                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13635 0000120D 46                      		inc	si
 13636                                  		; si = disksector+27h 
 13637                                  		;mov	si, disksector+27h ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL
 13638 0000120E 83C702                  		add	di, 2		; A_MEDIA_ID_INFO.MI_SERIAL
 13639 00001211 B91700                  		mov	cx, 23		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 13640                                  					; L+size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 13641                                  					; +size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 13642 00001214 F3A4                    		rep movsb		; Move from Bios_Data into request packet
 13643                                  	
 13644                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13645                                  		; cf = 0
 13646                                  		;clc
 13647                                  
 13648 00001216 C3                      		retn
 13649                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13650                                  
 13651                                  IOCtl_If2:				
 13652 00001217 B007                    		mov	al, 7		; error_unknown_media
 13653 00001219 F9                      		stc
 13654                                  IOCtl_If1:				
 13655 0000121A C3                      		retn
 13656                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13657                                  
 13658                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13659                                  
 13660                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13661                                  ;  set media id
 13662                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13663                                  
 13664                                  ; function: set the volume label, the system id and the serial number of
 13665                                  ;	    the media that has the extended boot record.
 13666                                  ;	    for the conventional media, this routine will return "unknown
 13667                                  ;	    media.." error to dos.
 13668                                  ;	    this routine will also set the corresponding informations in
 13669                                  ;	    the bds table.
 13670                                  ;
 13671                                  ; input :   ES:di -> bds table for this drive.
 13672                                  ;
 13673                                  ; output:   the extended boot record in the media will be set according to
 13674                                  ;	    the request packet.
 13675                                  ;	    if carry set, then al contains the device driver error number
 13676                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 13677                                  ;
 13678                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 13679                                  ;	BootIo:NEAR
 13680                                  ;
 13681                                  ; logic:
 13682                                  ;
 13683                                  ; {
 13684                                  ;	get drive_number from bds;
 13685                                  ;	rFlag = "read operation";
 13686                                  ;	BootIo;
 13687                                  ;	if (no error) then
 13688                                  ;	     if (extended boot record) then
 13689                                  ;		{ set volume label,volume serial number and system id
 13690                                  ;		  of the boot record to those of the request packet;
 13691                                  ;		  rFlag = "write operation";
 13692                                  ;		  get drive number from bds;
 13693                                  ;		  BootIo;	  /*write it back*/
 13694                                  ;		};
 13695                                  ;	     else		  /*not an extended bpb */
 13696                                  ;		{ set register al to "unknown media.." error code;
 13697                                  ;		  set carry bit;
 13698                                  ;		  ret;	 /*return back to caller */
 13699                                  ;		};
 13700                                  ;	else
 13701                                  ;	     ret;		 /*already error code is set */
 13702                                  ;
 13703                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13704                                  
 13705                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13706                                  SetMediaId:
 13707 0000121B E86900                  		call	ChangeLineChk
 13708 0000121E 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 13709                                  					; Logical drive	number
 13710 00001222 88C2                    		mov	dl, al
 13711 00001224 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2	; romread
 13712 00001229 52                      		push	dx
 13713 0000122A E84200                  		call	BootIo		; Read boot sec	to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 13714 0000122D 5A                      		pop	dx
 13715 0000122E 723E                    		jb	short IOCtl_If6
 13716                                  					; Valid? (0F0h-0FFh?)
 13717 00001230 803E[6301]F0            		cmp	byte [disksector+15h], 0F0h
 13718                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 13719 00001235 7234                    		jb	short IOCtl_If7	; Brif not
 13720 00001237 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h ; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG]
 13721                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 13722 0000123C 752D                    		jnz	short IOCtl_If7	; not extended boot record
 13723 0000123E 06                      		push	es		; Save BDS pointer
 13724 0000123F 57                      		push	di
 13725 00001240 1E                      		push	ds		; Point	ES To boot record
 13726 00001241 07                      		pop	es
 13727 00001242 BF[7501]                		mov	di, disksector+27h ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL
 13728 00001245 C536[1200]              		lds	si, [ptrsav]	; ds:si	points to request header.
 13729 00001249 C57413                  		lds	si, [si+19]	; [si+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13730 0000124C 83C602                  		add	si, 2		; A_MEDIA_ID_INFO.MI_SERIAL
 13731 0000124F B91700                  		mov	cx, 23		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 13732                                  					; +size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 13733                                  					; +size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 13734 00001252 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13735 00001254 06                      		push	es		; point	ds back	to Bios_Data
 13736 00001255 1F                      		pop	ds
 13737 00001256 5F                      		pop	di		; restore bds pointer
 13738 00001257 07                      		pop	es
 13739 00001258 E876F5                  		call	mov_media_ids	; update the bds media id info.
 13740 0000125B 88D0                    		mov	al, dl
 13741 0000125D C606[2001]03            		mov	byte [rflag], 3	; romwrite
 13742 00001262 E80A00                  		call	BootIo		; write	it back.
 13743 00001265 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh
 13744                                  					; make sure chk_media check the driver
 13745                                  					; return with error code from BootIo
 13746 0000126A C3                      		retn
 13747                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13748                                  
 13749                                  IOCtl_If7:				
 13750 0000126B B007                    		mov	al, 7		; error_unknown_media
 13751 0000126D F9                      		stc
 13752                                  IOCtl_If6:				
 13753 0000126E C3                      		retn
 13754                                  
 13755                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13756                                  
 13757                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13758                                  
 13759                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13760                                  ;	BootIo
 13761                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13762                                  ;
 13763                                  ; function: read/write the boot record into boot sector.
 13764                                  ;
 13765                                  ; input :
 13766                                  ;	    al=logical drive number
 13767                                  ;	    rFlag = operation (read/write)
 13768                                  ;
 13769                                  ; output:   for read operation,the boot record of the drive specified in bds
 13770                                  ;	    be read into the DiskSector buffer.
 13771                                  ;	    for write operation,the DiskSector buffer image will be written
 13772                                  ;	    to the drive specified in bds.
 13773                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 13774                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 13775                                  ;	    AX,CX,DX register destroyed.
 13776                                  ;	    if carry set,then al will contain the error code from DiskIO.
 13777                                  ;
 13778                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 13779                                  ;	DiskIO:NEAR
 13780                                  ;
 13781                                  ; logic:
 13782                                  ;
 13783                                  ; {
 13784                                  ;	first_sector = 0;	 /*logical sector 0 is the boot sector */
 13785                                  ;	sectorcount = 1;	 /*read 1 sector only */
 13786                                  ;	buffer = DiskSector;	 /*read it into the DiskSector buffer */
 13787                                  ;	call DiskIO (rFlag,drive_number,first_sector,sectorcount,buffer);
 13788                                  ; }
 13789                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13790                                  
 13791                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13792                                  BootIo:	
 13793 0000126F 06                      		push	es
 13794 00001270 57                      		push	di
 13795 00001271 53                      		push	bx
 13796 00001272 1E                      		push	ds
 13797 00001273 07                      		pop	es		; Point ES: to Bios_Data
 13798                                  
 13799                                  		; Call DiskIO to read/write the boot sec. The parameters which
 13800                                  		; need to be initialized for this subroutine out here are
 13801                                  		; - Transfer address to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 13802                                  		; - Low sector needs to be initalized to 0. this is a reg. param
 13803                                  		; - Hi sector in [Start_Sec_H] needs to be initialised to 0.
 13804                                  		; - Number of sectors <-- 1
 13805                                  
 13806 00001274 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; es:di -> transfer address
 13807 00001277 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; First	sector (h) -> 0
 13808 00001279 8916[2305]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx ; Start sector (h) -> 0
 13809 0000127D B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
 13810 00001280 E8E0F6                  		call	diskio
 13811 00001283 5B                      		pop	bx
 13812 00001284 5F                      		pop	di
 13813 00001285 07                      		pop	es
 13814 00001286 C3                      		retn
 13815                                  
 13816                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13817                                  
 13818                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13819                                  
 13820                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13821                                  ;	ChangeLineChk
 13822                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13823                                  ;
 13824                                  ; when the user calls get/set media id call before dos establishes the media
 13825                                  ; by calling "media_chk",the change line activity of the drive is going to be
 13826                                  ; lost.	this routine will check the change line activity and will save the
 13827                                  ; history in the flags.
 13828                                  ;
 13829                                  ; FUNCTION: check the change line error activity
 13830                                  ;
 13831                                  ; INPUT :  ES:di -> bds table.
 13832                                  ;
 13833                                  ; OUTPUT:   flag in bds table will be updated if change line occurs.
 13834                                  ;
 13835                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 13836                                  ;	Set_Changed_DL
 13837                                  ;
 13838                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13839                                  
 13840                                  ChangeLineChk:	
 13841 00001287 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13842 0000128B 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; Fixed	disk?
 13843 0000128D 7821                    		js	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Yes, skip it.
 13844                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13845 0000128F 26F6452304              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 4
 13846                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 4 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13847                                  					; return_fake_bpb
 13848 00001294 751A                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 13849 00001296 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1	; This rom support change line?
 13850 0000129B 7513                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 13851 0000129D E8EB06                  		call	haschange	; This drive support change line?
 13852 000012A0 740E                    		jz	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Do nothing
 13853                                  
 13854                                  		; Execute the rom disk interrupt to check changeline activity.
 13855                                  
 13856 000012A2 B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 13857 000012A4 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 13858                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 13859                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status
 13860 000012A6 7308                    		jnb	short ChangeLnChkRet
 13861 000012A8 53                      		push	bx
 13862 000012A9 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13863                                  					; Update flag in BDS for this
 13864                                  					; physical drive
 13865 000012AC E8B506                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13866 000012AF 5B                      		pop	bx
 13867                                  ChangeLnChkRet:				
 13868 000012B0 C3                      		retn
 13869                                  
 13870                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13871                                  
 13872                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13873                                  
 13874                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13875                                  ;	GetAccessFlag
 13876                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13877                                  ;
 13878                                  ; FUNCTION: get the status of UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 13879                                  ;
 13880                                  ; INPUT :
 13881                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 13882                                  ;
 13883                                  ; OUTPUT:   a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 if disk i/o not allowed.
 13884                                  ;						 = 1 if disk i/o allowed.
 13885                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13886                                  
 13887                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13888                                  GetAccessFlag:				
 13889 000012B1 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 13890 000012B5 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13891                                  		;mov	al, 0		; Assume result	is unformatted
 13892                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13893 000012B8 28C0                    		sub	al, al
 13894                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13895 000012BA 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 13896                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13897                                  					; unformatted_media
 13898 000012BF 7502                    		jnz	short GafDone	; Done if unformatted
 13899 000012C1 FEC0                    		inc	al		; Return true for formatted
 13900                                  
 13901                                  GafDone:				
 13902 000012C3 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 13903 000012C6 C3                      		retn
 13904                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13905                                  
 13906                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13907                                  
 13908                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13909                                  ;	SetAccessFlag
 13910                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13911                                  ;
 13912                                  ; function: set/reset the UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 13913                                  ;
 13914                                  ; input :
 13915                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 13916                                  ;
 13917                                  ; output:   unformtted_media bit modified according to the user request
 13918                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13919                                  
 13920                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13921                                  SetAccessFlag:				
 13922 000012C7 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	points to request header
 13923 000012CB C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13924                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13925 000012CE 26806524FD              		and	byte [es:di+36], 0FDh
 13926                                  		;and	word [es:di+35], 0FDFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13927                                  					; ~unformatted_media
 13928 000012D3 807F0100                		cmp	byte [bx+1], 0	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 13929 000012D7 7505                    		jnz	short saf_Done
 13930                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13931 000012D9 26804D2402              		or	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 13932                                  		;or	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13933                                  					; unformatted_media
 13934                                  saf_Done:				
 13935 000012DE C3                      		retn
 13936                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13937                                  
 13938                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13939                                  
 13940                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13941                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 13942                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13943                                  ;
 13944                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 13945                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 13946                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 13947                                  ;
 13948                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13949                                  
 13950                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13951                                  ioctl_support_query:
 13952 000012DF 06                      		push	es
 13953 000012E0 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 13954 000012E4 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 13955                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 13956                                  
 13957                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13958                                  		;cmp	al, 48h		; IOC_NEW_DC (PCDOS 7.1)
 13959                                  		;			; new generic ioctl function (FAT32)
 13960                                  		;jz	short ioctl_support
 13961                                  
 13962 000012E8 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 13963                                  					; See if major code is 8
 13964 000012EA 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 13965                                  ioctl_support:
 13966 000012EC 0E                      		push	cs
 13967 000012ED 07                      		pop	es
 13968                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13969                                  		;mov	cx, 14          ; (PCDOS 7.1) IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13970 000012EE B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13971                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13972 000012F1 BF[D20C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 13973                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 13974                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 13975 000012F4 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 13976 000012F6 F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 13977 000012F8 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 13978 000012FA B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 13979                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13980                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 13981                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 13982                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 13983                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 13984                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13985                                  ioctlsupexit:
 13986 000012FD 07                      		pop	es
 13987                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13988                                  		; cf = 0
 13989                                  		;clc
 13990 000012FE C3                      		retn
 13991                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13992                                  nosupport:
 13993 000012FF 07                      		pop	es
 13994 00001300 E9D2ED                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 13995                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13996                                  
 13997                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13998                                  
 13999                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14000                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 14001                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14002                                  ;
 14003                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 14004                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 14005                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 14006                                  ;	    drive)
 14007                                  ;
 14008                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 14009                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 14010                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 14011                                  ;
 14012                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 14013                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 14014                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 14015                                  ;
 14016                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 14017                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 14018                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 14019                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 14020                                  ;
 14021                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 14022                                  ;
 14023                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 14024                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 14025                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 14026                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 14027                                  ; 
 14028                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14029                                  
 14030                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14031                                  SenseMediaType:				
 14032 00001303 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 14033 00001307 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 14034                                  		; 10/10/2022
 14035                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 14036 0000130A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14037 0000130C 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 14038                                  		;
 14039 0000130E 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14040                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 14041                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14042                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 14043 00001312 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 14044                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 14045 00001314 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 14046 00001316 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 14047 00001318 FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 14048                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 14049 0000131A FEC8                    		dec	al
 14050 0000131C 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 14051 0000131E 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 14052 00001320 0404                    		add	al, 4
 14053 00001322 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 14054 00001324 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 14055 00001326 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 14056 00001328 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 14057                                  GotMediaType:				
 14058 0000132A 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 14059                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14060                                  		; cf = 0
 14061                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 14062 0000132D C3                      		retn
 14063                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14064                                  
 14065                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 14066 0000132E 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 14067 00001331 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 14068 00001333 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 14069 00001335 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 14070 00001338 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 14071                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 14072 0000133A B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 14073                                  SenseErrExit:				
 14074 0000133C B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 14075 0000133E F9                      		stc
 14076 0000133F C3                      		retn
 14077                                  
 14078                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14079                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14080                                  		;db    0
 14081                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14082                                  
 14083                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14084                                  
 14085                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14086                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 14087                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14088                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14089                                  
 14090                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 14091                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 14092                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 14093                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 14094                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 14095                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 14096                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 14097                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 14098                                  ;
 14099                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 14100                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 14101                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 14102                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 14103                                  ;
 14104                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 14105                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 14106                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 14107                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 14108                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 14109                                  ;
 14110                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 14111                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 14112                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 14113                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 14114                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 14115                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 14116                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 14117                                  
 14118                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 14119                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 14120                                  
 14121                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 14122                                  
 14123                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 14124 00001340 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 14125 00001343 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 14126 00001345 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 14127 00001348 7431                    		jz	short mine
 14128                                  
 14129                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 14130                                  
 14131 0000134A 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 14132 0000134D 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 14133 0000134F 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 14134 00001352 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 14135 00001354 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 14136                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14137                                  
 14138                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 14139 00001357 CF                      		iret
 14140                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14141                                  
 14142                                  int2f_replace_int13:
 14143 00001358 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 14144 00001359 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 14145                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 14146                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14147                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14148 0000135B 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 14149                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14150                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 14151                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 14152                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 14153                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 14154                                  		
 14155                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14156                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 14157 00001360 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 14158                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 14159 00001364 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 14160                                  
 14161                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 14162                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 14163                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 14164                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 14165                                  		
 14166                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 14167                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14168 00001368 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 14169 0000136C A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 14170                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 14171                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14172 0000136F 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 14173 00001373 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 14174                                  
 14175 00001377 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 14176                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14177                                  		;pop	bx
 14178 00001378 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 14179                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 14180 00001379 58                      		pop	ax
 14181                                  i2f_iret:
 14182 0000137A CF                      		iret
 14183                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14184                                  
 14185                                  mine:
 14186 0000137B 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 14187 0000137D 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 14188 0000137F 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 14189 00001381 7503                    		jnz	short disp_func
 14190 00001383 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 14191                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 14192                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14193 00001385 CF                      		iret
 14194                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14195                                  
 14196                                  disp_func:
 14197 00001386 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 14198 00001388 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 14199 0000138A 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 14200 0000138C 7423                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 14201                                  
 14202                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 14203                                  
 14204 0000138E 1E                      		push	ds
 14205 0000138F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 14206                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14207                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 14208                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14209                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 14210                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es
 14211 00001394 891E[1200]              		mov	[ptrsav], bx
 14212 00001398 8C06[1400]              		mov	[ptrsav+2], es
 14213 0000139C 1F                      		pop	ds
 14214                                  		;jmp	far ptr	i2f_dskentry
 14215                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 14216                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1708h
 14217 0000139D EA[1907]7000            		jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry ; BIOSDATA:dsk_entry
 14218                                  		;; 17/10/2022
 14219                                  		;;jmp	far DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry		
 14220                                  		; 20/09/2023
 14221                                  		;jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:i2f_dskentry ; 70h:i2f_dskentry
 14222                                  					; NOTE: jump to a FAR function, not an
 14223                                  					;  IRET type function. Callers of
 14224                                  					;  this int2f subfunction will have
 14225                                  					;  to be careful to do a popf
 14226                                  
 14227                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14228                                  
 14229                                  do_subfun_01:
 14230 000013A2 06                      		push	es
 14231 000013A3 1E                      		push	ds
 14232 000013A4 1E                      		push	ds
 14233 000013A5 07                      		pop	es
 14234                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14235 000013A6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]	
 14236                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14237                                  					; point	ds: -> Bios_Data
 14238 000013AB E8BC03                  		call	install_bds
 14239 000013AE 1F                      		pop	ds
 14240 000013AF 07                      		pop	es
 14241                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 14242                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14243 000013B0 CF                      		iret
 14244                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14245                                  
 14246                                  do_get_bds_vector:
 14247                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14248 000013B1 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]			
 14249                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14250 000013B6 C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 14251                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 14252                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 14253                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 14254                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14255 000013BA CF                      		iret
 14256                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14257                                  
 14258                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14259                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14260                                  
 14261                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 14262                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 14263                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 14264                                  
 14265                                  win386call:				
 14266 000013BB 1E                      		push	ds
 14267 000013BC 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14268                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14269                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h

 14271                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 14272 000013C3 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 14273 000013C5 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 14274                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 14275 000013C7 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 14276                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14277 000013C9 F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 14278                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 14279 000013CC 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 14280                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 14281 000013CE 8026[6F08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 14282 000013D3 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 14283                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14284                                  
 14285                                  Win386Init:
 14286                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14287 000013D5 F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 14288                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 14289 000013D8 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 14290                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 14291 000013DA 800E[6F08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 14292                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 14293                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 14294 000013DF 891E[3D08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 14295 000013E3 8C06[3F08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 14296                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 14297 000013E7 BB[3B08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 14298 000013EA 1E                      		push	ds
 14299 000013EB 07                      		pop	es
 14300                                  win_iret:
 14301 000013EC 1F                      		pop	ds
 14302                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 14303                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 14304                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14305 000013ED CF                      		iret
 14306                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14307                                  
 14308                                  handle_multmult:
 14309 000013EE 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 14310 000013F0 7514                    		jnz	short try_2
 14311 000013F2 1E                      		push	ds
 14312 000013F3 E84500                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 14313                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14314                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 14315                                  		;dec	bx
 14316 000013F6 BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 14317 000013F9 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 14318 000013FB 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 14319 000013FD F7D3                    		not	bx
 14320 000013FF 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 14321 00001401 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 14322 00001403 43                      		inc	bx
 14323                                  try_1:
 14324 00001404 1F                      		pop	ds
 14325                                  		;jmp	short ii2f_iret
 14326                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14327 00001405 CF                      		iret
 14328                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14329                                  
 14330                                  try_2:
 14331 00001406 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 14332 00001408 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 14333 0000140A 1E                      		push	ds
 14334                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14335                                  		;xor	di, di
 14336                                  		;dec	di
 14337 0000140B BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 14338 0000140E 8EC7                    		mov	es, di

 14340 00001413 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14341 00001416 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA

 14343 0000141A 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 14344 0000141C 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 14345                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14346                                  		;sub	di, di
 14347                                  		;dec	di
 14348 0000141E BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 14349                                  		;jmp	short InsuffHMA
 14350                                  		; 02/09/2023

 14352 00001422 CF                      		iret

 14381                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14382                                  
 14383                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14384                                  
 14385                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14386                                  ;
 14387                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14388                                  ;
 14389                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14390                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14391                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14392                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14393                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14394                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14395                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14396                                  ;
 14397                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14398                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14399                                  ;
 14400                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14401                                  
 14402                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14403                                  HMAPtr:
 14404 0000143B 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14405                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14406 00001440 8B3E[9508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14407                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14408 00001444 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14409 00001447 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14410 00001449 803E[9B08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14411                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14412 0000144E 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14413 00001450 FF1E[9708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14414                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14415 00001454 8B3E[9508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14416                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14417                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14418 00001458 C3                      		retn
 14419                                  
 14420                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14421                                  
 14422                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14423                                  
 14424                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14425                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14426                                  
 14427                                  move_sector:
 14428                                  
 14429                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14430                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14431                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14432                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14433                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14434                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14435                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14436                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14437                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14438                                  ;
 14439                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14440                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14441                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14442                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14443                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14444                                  
 14445 00001459 FC                      		cld
 14446 0000145A 51                      		push	cx
 14447 0000145B B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14448 0000145E 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14449 00001462 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14450 00001464 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14451 00001468 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14452 0000146A F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14453 0000146C 59                      		pop	cx
 14454 0000146D C3                      		retn
 14455                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14456                                  
 14457                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14458 0000146E D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14459 00001470 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14460 00001472 59                      		pop	cx
 14461 00001473 C3                      		retn
 14462                                  
 14463                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14464                                  
 14465                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14466                                  
 14467                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14468                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14469                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14470                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14471                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14472                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14473                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14474                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14475                                  ;
 14476                                  ; input conditions:
 14477                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14478                                  ;
 14479                                  ; output:
 14480                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14481                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14482                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14483                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14484                                  
 14485                                  check_wrap:	
 14486 00001474 50                      		push	ax
 14487 00001475 53                      		push	bx
 14488 00001476 06                      		push	es
 14489 00001477 57                      		push	di
 14490 00001478 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14491 0000147B 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14492                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14493 0000147D 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14494                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14495 00001482 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14496 00001484 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14497 00001488 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14498 0000148A 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14499 0000148D 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14500 0000148F 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14501 00001491 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14502                                  
 14503                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14504                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14505                                  
 14506 00001493 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14507 00001495 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14508                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14509 00001497 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14510 00001498 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14511                                  					; if on	boundary
 14512                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14513                                  not_on_bound:
 14514 0000149A 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14515 0000149D 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14516 0000149F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14517 000014A1 40                      		inc	ax
 14518 000014A2 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14519 000014A4 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14520                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14521 000014A7 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14522 000014AB 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14523                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14524                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14525 000014AD 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14526 000014AF 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14527 000014B0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14528                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14529 000014B2 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14530                                  
 14531                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14532                                  
 14533 000014B4 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14534 000014B6 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14535 000014B8 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14536                                  
 14537                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14538                                  
 14539 000014BA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14540 000014BC 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14541 000014BE 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14542                                  no_head_bound:				
 14543 000014BF 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14544 000014C1 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14545 000014C2 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14546 000014C4 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14547 000014C6 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14548 000014C8 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14549 000014CB B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14550 000014CD 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14551 000014CF D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14552 000014D1 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14553 000014D3 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14554 000014D5 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14555 000014D7 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14556 000014D9 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14557                                  no_wrap:				
 14558 000014DB F8                      		clc
 14559 000014DC 5F                      		pop	di
 14560 000014DD 07                      		pop	es
 14561 000014DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 14562 000014DF 58                      		pop	ax
 14563 000014E0 C3                      		retn
 14564                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14565                                  
 14566                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14567 000014E1 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14568 000014E3 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14569 000014E5 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14570                                  
 14571                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14572                                  
 14573                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14574                                  
 14575                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14576                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14577                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14578                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14579                                  ;
 14580                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14581                                  
 14582                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14583                                  find_bds:	
 14584 000014E7 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14585                                  fbds_1:					
 14586 000014EB 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14587 000014EF 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14588 000014F1 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14589                                  					; go to next bds
 14590 000014F4 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14591 000014F7 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14592 000014F9 F9                      		stc
 14593                                  fdbs_2:					
 14594 000014FA C3                      		retn
 14595                                  
 14596                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14597                                  
 14598                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14599                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14600                                  doint:
 14601                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14602 000014FB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14603                                  					; get physical drive number
 14604                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14605                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14606                                  		
 14607 000014FE 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14608 00001500 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14609 00001502 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14610                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14611 00001504 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14612                                  					; get request code
 14613                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14614 00001507 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14615                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14616 0000150A 9D                      		popf
 14617                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14618                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14619 0000150B 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14620                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14621                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14622 00001510 9C                      		pushf
 14623                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14624 00001511 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14625                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14626                                  dointdone:				
 14627 00001514 C3                      		retn
 14628                                  
 14629                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14630                                  
 14631                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14632                                  
 14633                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14634                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14635                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14636                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14637                                  ;
 14638                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14639                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14640                                  ;
 14641                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14642                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14643                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14644                                  
 14645                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14646                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14647                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14648                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14649                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14650                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14651                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14652                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14653                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14654                                  ;end struc
 14655                                  
 14656                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14657                                  
 14658                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14659                                  ;	ah = function
 14660                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14661                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14662                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14663                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14664                                  ;   output conditions:
 14665                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14666                                  
 14667                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14668                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14669                                  ;
 14670                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14671                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14672                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14673                                  
 14674                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14675                                  
 14676                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14677                                  
 14678 00001515 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14679                                  
 14680                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14681                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14682                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14683                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14684                                  
 14685                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14686                                  
 14687                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14688                                  
 14689                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14690                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14691                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14692                                  
 14693                                  format_special_stuff:			
 14694 00001519 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14695 0000151E 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14696 00001520 53                      		push	bx
 14697 00001521 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14698 00001524 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14699 00001527 5B                      		pop	bx
 14700 00001528 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14701                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14702                                  
 14703                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14704                                  
 14705                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14706                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14707                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14708                                  
 14709                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14710                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 14711 0000152A 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14712 0000152C 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done

 14718 00001536 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?

 14722                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35

 14727                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14728                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
