 14732                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14733                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14734 0000154E 07                      		pop	es
 14735 0000154F 5B                      		pop	bx
 14736 00001550 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14737                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14738                                  
 14739                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14740                                  
 14741                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14742                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14743                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14744                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14745                                  
 14746                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 14747 00001552 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14748                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14749 00001557 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem

 14751                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14752 0000155E 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14753                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 14754 00001560 50                      		push	ax
 14755 00001561 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14756                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14757                                  		; 17/10/2022

 14759                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14760                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14761 00001568 58                      		pop	ax
 14762 00001569 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14763                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14764                                  
 14765                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14766                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14767                                  
 14768                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14769                                  
 14770                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14771                                  
 14772                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14773                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14774                                  
 14775                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14776 0000156B 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14777                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14778                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data

 14780                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14781                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14782                                  
 14783                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14784                                  
 14785 00001571 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14786 00001574 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat

 14788                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14789                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14790 00001579 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14791 0000157E 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14792                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14793                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14794                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 14795 00001580 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14796                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14797                                  		
 14798 00001585 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14799

 14801                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14802 0000158B 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14803                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14804                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so

 14806 0000158E 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14807                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14808 00001590 1F                      		pop	ds
 14809 00001591 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14810                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14811                                  
 14812                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14813                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14814                                  ; a changeline error.
 14815                                  
 14816                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14817 00001594 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14818                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14819 00001596 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14820 00001599 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14821 0000159B 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14822 0000159D 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14823 0000159F 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14824 000015A4 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14825                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14826                                  					; never	would

 14829 000015AA E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14830 000015AD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14831                                  int13b:					
 14832 000015AE F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14833 000015AF EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14834                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14835                                  
 14836                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14837                                  
 14838                                  goterr13:				
 14839 000015B1 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14840 000015B4 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14841                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14842 000015B6 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14843 000015B9 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14844 000015BB 803E[3006]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14845 000015C0 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14846                                  
 14847 000015C2 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14848                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14849                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14850                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14851 000015C7 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14852                                  
 14853 000015C9 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14854                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14855                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14856 000015CB 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14857                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14858                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14859 000015D0 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14860 000015D3 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14861 000015D5 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14862 000015D7 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14863 000015D9 53                      		push	bx
 14864 000015DA 51                      		push	cx
 14865 000015DB 52                      		push	dx
 14866 000015DC A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14867                                  loop_ecc:				
 14868 000015DF B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14869                                  
 14870                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14871                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14872                                  ;
 14873                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14874                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14875                                  ; track.
 14876                                  ;
 14877                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14878                                  ; this request.
 14879                                  ;
 14880                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14881                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14882                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14883                                  ;
 14884 000015E2 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14885                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14886                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14887 000015E5 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14888                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14889 000015EA 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14890 000015EC 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14891 000015EF 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14892 000015F1 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14893 000015F4 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14894                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14895                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14896                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14897 000015F6 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14898                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14899                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14900                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14901                                  ok11_op:				
 14902 000015F8 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14903 000015FC 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14904 000015FE FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14905                                  					; add 200h to address
 14906 00001600 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14907 00001602 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14908 00001604 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14909                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14910                                  
 14911                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14912                                  
 14913                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14914 00001606 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14915                                  ok11_exit:				
 14916 00001607 5A                      		pop	dx
 14917 00001608 59                      		pop	cx
 14918 00001609 5B                      		pop	bx
 14919 0000160A EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14920                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14921                                  
 14922                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14923                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14924                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14925                                  
 14926                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14927 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14928 0000160D 53                      		push	bx
 14929 0000160E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14930 00001611 1E                      		push	ds
 14931 00001612 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14932 00001613 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14933                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14934                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14935 00001616 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14936                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14937 0000161B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14938 0000161C 07                      		pop	es
 14939 0000161D 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14940 0000161F 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14941 00001622 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14942                                  
 14943                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14944                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14945                                  
 14946                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14947 00001624 56                      		push	si
 14948 00001625 57                      		push	di
 14949 00001626 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14950 00001628 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14951 0000162B E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14952 0000162E 5F                      		pop	di
 14953 0000162F 5E                      		pop	si
 14954 00001630 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14955                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14956                                  
 14957                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14958                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14959                                  
 14960                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14961 00001632 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14962 00001635 FB                      		sti
 14963 00001636 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14964 00001639 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14965                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14966                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14967 0000163B 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14968 0000163E 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14969 00001640 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14970 00001643 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14971 00001645 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14972                                  
 14973                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14974                                  
 14975                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14976                                  
 14977 00001647 52                      		push	dx
 14978 00001648 51                      		push	cx
 14979 00001649 53                      		push	bx
 14980 0000164A 50                      		push	ax
 14981 0000164B 55                      		push	bp
 14982 0000164C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14983 0000164E 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14984 00001650 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14985 00001652 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14986 00001654 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14987 00001656 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14988 00001658 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14989 0000165A 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14990                                  
 14991                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14992                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14993                                  
 14994 0000165E 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14995 00001660 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14996                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14997                                  
 14998                                  no_skip_first:				
 14999 00001663 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 15000 00001665 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 15001 00001667 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 15002                                  
 15003                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 15004                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 15005                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 15006                                  ;
 15007                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 15008                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 15009                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 15010                                  ; in error.
 15011                                  
 15012 00001669 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 15013 0000166B 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 15014                                  
 15015                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 15016                                  
 15017 0000166D 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15018                                  					; set up head number
 15019 00001670 E888FE                  		call	doint
 15020 00001673 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 15021                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15022                                  
 15023                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 15024 00001676 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 15025 00001678 F9                      		stc
 15026 00001679 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 15027                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 15028                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15029                                  
 15030                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 15031                                  
 15032                                  intverify:				
 15033 0000167C 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 15034 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 15035 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 15036 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 15037                                  dosimple:				
 15038 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15039                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 15040                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 15041                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15042 00001683 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15043                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15044 00001688 5B                      		pop	bx
 15045 00001689 07                      		pop	es
 15046 0000168A E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15047                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15048                                  
 15049                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 15050                                  
 15051                                  intformat:				
 15052 0000168D 06                      		push	es
 15053 0000168E 53                      		push	bx
 15054 0000168F 56                      		push	si
 15055 00001690 57                      		push	di
 15056 00001691 1E                      		push	ds
 15057                                  
 15058                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 15059                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 15060                                  
 15061 00001692 06                      		push	es
 15062 00001693 1E                      		push	ds
 15063 00001694 07                      		pop	es
 15064 00001695 1F                      		pop	ds
 15065 00001696 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 15066 00001698 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 15067 0000169B E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 15068 0000169E 1F                      		pop	ds
 15069 0000169F 5F                      		pop	di
 15070 000016A0 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 15071 000016A1 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 15072                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15073                                  
 15074                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 15075                                  ; the first block.
 15076                                  ;
 15077                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 15078                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 15079                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 15080                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 15081                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 15082                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 15083                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 15084                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 15085                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 15086                                  
 15087                                  doblock:
 15088                                  
 15089                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 15090                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 15091                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 15092                                  				
 15093 000016A3 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15094                                  					; get head #, drive #
 15095 000016A6 51                      		push	cx
 15096 000016A7 06                      		push	es
 15097 000016A8 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15098                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 15099 000016A9 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 15100 000016AC 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 15101                                  		; 12/12/2022
 15102 000016B0 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 15103                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 15104 000016B5 5F                      		pop	di
 15105 000016B6 07                      		pop	es
 15106 000016B7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 15107 000016B9 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 15108 000016BB B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 15109 000016BD 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15110                                  doblockflop:				
 15111 000016BF 59                      		pop	cx
 15112                                  doblockcontinue:			
 15113 000016C0 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 15114 000016C2 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 15115 000016C4 50                      		push	ax
 15116 000016C5 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 15117 000016C7 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 15118                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15119                                  
 15120                                  doblocklast:				
 15121 000016C9 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 15122 000016CB 50                      		push	ax
 15123                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 15124 000016CC E82CFE                  		call	doint
 15125 000016CF 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 15126 000016D1 58                      		pop	ax
 15127 000016D2 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 15128                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 15129 000016D5 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 15130 000016D7 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 15131 000016D9 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 15132 000016DB 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 15133 000016DD 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 15134                                  					; then we are done already.
 15135 000016DF 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15136                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15137 000016E1 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15138 000016E4 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15139                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15140                                  
 15141                                  bufferx:				
 15142 000016E6 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15143                                  					; set up head number
 15144                                  buffer:					
 15145 000016E9 53                      		push	bx
 15146 000016EA 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15147 000016ED 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15148 000016F0 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15149                                  					
 15150                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15151                                  
 15152 000016F2 06                      		push	es
 15153 000016F3 1E                      		push	ds
 15154 000016F4 56                      		push	si
 15155 000016F5 57                      		push	di
 15156 000016F6 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15157 000016F7 06                      		push	es
 15158 000016F8 1F                      		pop	ds
 15159 000016F9 07                      		pop	es
 15160 000016FA BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15161 000016FD 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15162 000016FE 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15163 00001700 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15164 00001703 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15165                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15166 00001704 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15167 00001705 5E                      		pop	si
 15168 00001706 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15169                                  
 15170                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15171                                  
 15172 00001707 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15173                                  					; get drive number
 15174 00001709 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15175 0000170C E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15176                                  					;
 15177                                  					; ah is	function
 15178                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15179                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15180                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15181                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15182                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15183 0000170F E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15184 00001712 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15185 00001713 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15186 00001715 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15187                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15188                                  
 15189                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15190                                  
 15191                                  doread:					
 15192 00001717 06                      		push	es
 15193 00001718 53                      		push	bx
 15194 00001719 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15195 0000171A 07                      		pop	es
 15196 0000171B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15197 0000171E B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15198 00001720 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15199                                  					; get drive number
 15200 00001723 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15201                                  					; ah = function
 15202                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15203                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15204                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15205 00001726 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15206 00001729 5B                      		pop	bx
 15207 0000172A 07                      		pop	es
 15208 0000172B 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15209 0000172D 56                      		push	si
 15210 0000172E 57                      		push	di
 15211 0000172F 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15212 00001731 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15213 00001734 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15214 00001737 5F                      		pop	di
 15215 00001738 5E                      		pop	si
 15216                                  
 15217                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15218                                  
 15219                                  dotail:					
 15220 00001739 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15221 0000173A 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15222 0000173D 41                      		inc	cx
 15223 0000173E 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15224 00001741 F8                      		clc
 15225 00001742 FEC8                    		dec	al
 15226 00001744 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15227                                  
 15228                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15229                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15230                                  
 15231 00001746 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15232 00001749 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15233 0000174C E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15234                                  
 15235                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15236                                  
 15237                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15238                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15239                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15240                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15241                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15242                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15243                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15244                                  
 15245                                  bad13:					
 15246 0000174F 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15247 00001751 5D                      		pop	bp
 15248 00001752 5B                      		pop	bx
 15249 00001753 5B                      		pop	bx
 15250 00001754 59                      		pop	cx
 15251 00001755 5A                      		pop	dx
 15252 00001756 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15253 00001758 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15254                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15255                                  
 15256                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 15257 0000175B E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15258                                  
 15259                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15260                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15261                                  		;db 	0
 15262                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15263                                  
 15264                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 15265

 15274                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h

 15281                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15282                                  
 15283                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15284                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15285                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15286                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15287                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15288                                  
 15289                                  install_bds:
 15290 0000176A 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15291 0000176B BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15292                                  
 15293                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15294                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15295                                  loop_next_bds:
 15296 0000176E C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15297                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15298 00001770 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15299 00001774 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15300                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15301 00001777 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15302 00001779 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15303 0000177B 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15304                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15305 0000177F 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15306 00001782 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15307                                  					; we don't own it
 15308 00001787 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15309                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15310 0000178A 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15311 0000178D 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15312                                  next_bds:
 15313                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15314 00001791 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15315 00001794 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15316                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15317                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 15318 00001796 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 15319 00001798 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 15320                                  					; install bds
 15321 0000179B 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 15322 0000179D 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15323                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15324                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15325 000017A0 1F                      		pop	ds
 15326
