 16320                                  section .SYSINIT vstart=0
 16321                                  
 16322                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 16323                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 16324                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16325                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 16326                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16327                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 16328                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16329                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 16330                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16331                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 16332                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16333                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 16334                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16335                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 16336                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 16337                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16338                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 16339                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 16340                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 16341                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 16342                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 16343                                  
 16344                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 16345                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 16346                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 16347                                   
 16348                                  ; 21/10/2022
 16349                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16350                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 16351                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 16352                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 16353                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16354                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 16355                                  
 16356                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 16357                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 16358                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 16359                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 16360                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 16361                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 16362                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 16363                                  ;
 16364                                  ;
 16365                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 16366                                  ;
 16367                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 16368                                  ;
 16369                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 16370                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 16371                                  ;
 16372                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 16373                                  ;
 16374                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 16375                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 16376                                  ;
 16377                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 16378                                  ;
 16379                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 16380                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 16381                                  ;value.
 16382                                  ;
 16383                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 16384                                  ;
 16385                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 16386                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 16387                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 16388                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 16389                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 16390                                  ;
 16391                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 16392                                  ;
 16393                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 16394                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 16395                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 16396                                  ;
 16397                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 16398                                  ;
 16399                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 16400                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 16401                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 16402                                  ;
 16403                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 16404                                  ;
 16405                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 16406                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 16407                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 16408                                  ;
 16409                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 16410                                  ;
 16411                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 16412                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 16413                                  ;
 16414                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 16415                                  ;
 16416                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 16417                                  ;
 16418                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 16419                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 16420                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 16421                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 16422                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 16423                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 16424                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 16425                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 16426                                  ;memory.
 16427                                  ;NOTES:
 16428                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 16429                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 16430                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 16431                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 16432                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 16433                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 16434                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 16435                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 16436                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 16437                                  
 16438                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16439                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 16440                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16441                                  
 16442                                  ;include version.inc
 16443                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16444                                  
 16445                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 16446                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 16447                                  
 16448                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 16449                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 16450                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 16451                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 16452                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 16453                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 16454                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 16455                                  
 16456                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 16457                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16458                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 16459                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 16460                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16461                                  
 16462                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 16463                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16464                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 16465                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 16466                                  
 16467                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 16468                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 16469                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 16470                                  
 16471                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 16472                                  
 16473                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 16474                                  				; currently 0.
 16475                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 16476                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 16477                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 16478                                  
 16479                                  ;      if1
 16480                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 16481                                  ;      endif
 16482                                  
 16483                                         ;******************************
 16484                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 16485                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 16486                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 16487                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 16488                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 16489                                         ;******************************
 16490                                  
 16491                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16492                                  ; device definitions
 16493                                  
 16494                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 16495                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 16496                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 16497                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 16498                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 16499                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 16500                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 16501                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 16502                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 16503                                  
 16504                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 16505                                  struc	SYSDEV
 16506 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 16507 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 16508 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 16509 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 16510 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 16511                                  .size:
 16512                                  endstruc
 16513                                  
 16514                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 16515                                  struc	SRHEAD
 16516 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 16517 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 16518 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 16519 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 16520 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 16521                                  .size:
 16522                                  endstruc
 16523                                  
 16524                                  ;Status word masks
 16525                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 16526                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 16527                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 16528                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 16529                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 16530                                  
 16531                                  ;Function codes
 16532                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 16533                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 16534                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 16535                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 16536                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 16537                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 16538                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 16539                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 16540                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 16541                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 16542                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 16543                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 16544                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 16545                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 16546                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 16547                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 16548                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 16549                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 16550                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 16551                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 16552                                  
 16553                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16554                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 16555 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 16556 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 16557 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 16558 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 16559 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 16560 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 16561                                                          ; word
 16562 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 16563 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 16564 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 16565 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 16566                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 16567                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 16568                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16569                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16570                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16571                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16572                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 16573                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16574 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 16575 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 16576 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 16577 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 16578 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 16579 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 16580                                  .size:
 16581                                  endstruc
 16582                                  
 16583                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16584                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 16585                                  
 16586                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 16587                                  
 16588                                  struc buffinfo
 16589 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 16590 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 16591 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16592                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 16593                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 16594 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 16595                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 16596                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 16597                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 16598                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 16599                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 16600                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 16601                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 16602                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 16603 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16604                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 16605 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 16606 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 16607 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 16608 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 16609 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 16610                                  .size:
 16611                                  endstruc
 16612                                  
 16613                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 16614                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 16615                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 16616                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 16617                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 16618                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 16619                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 16620                                  
 16621                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 16622                                  
 16623                                  
 16624                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 16625                                  
 16626                                  ;Flag byte masks
 16627                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 16628                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 16629                                  ;***
 16630                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 16631                                  ;***
 16632                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 16633                                  
 16634                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 16635                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 16636                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 16637                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 16638                                  
 16639                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 16640                                  
 16641                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16642                                  
 16643                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16644                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 16645                                  
 16646                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 16647                                  
 16648                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 16649                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 16650                                  ;
 16651                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 16652                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 16653                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 16654                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 16655                                  ;
 16656                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 16657                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 16658                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 16659                                  
 16660                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 16661                                  
 16662                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16663                                  
 16664                                  struc	DPB
 16665 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 16666 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 16667 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 16668 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 16669 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 16670 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 16671 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 16672 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 16673 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 16674 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 16675                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16676 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 16677 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 16678 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 16679 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 16680 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 16681                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 16682 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 16683 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 16684 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 16685                                  .size:
 16686                                  endstruc
 16687                                  
 16688                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 16689                                  
 16690                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 16691

 16747                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 16748                                  
 16749                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 16750                                  ;
 16751                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 16752                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 16753                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 16754                                  ;
 16755                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 16756                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 16757                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 16758                                  ;
 16759                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 16760                                  
 16761                                  struc A_BPB
 16762 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 16763 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 16764 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 16765 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 16766 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 16767 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16768 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 16769 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 16770 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 16771 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 16772 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 16773 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 16774 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16775 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 16776 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 16777                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 16778                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 16779                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 16780                                  .size:
 16781                                  endstruc
 16782                                  
 16783                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 16784 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 16785 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 16786 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 16787 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 16788 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 16789 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 16790 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 16791 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 16792                                  endstruc

 17040                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17041                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 17042                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17043                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 17044                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 17045                                  									  
 17046                                  ;*******************************					  
 17047                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 17048                                  ;*******************************					  
 17049                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 17050                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 17051                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 17052                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17053                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 17054                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 17055                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17056                                  ;For all others:							  
 17057                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 17058                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 17059                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 17060                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 17061                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 17062                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 17063                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 17064                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 17065                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17066                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 17067                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 17068                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 17069                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 17070                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 17071                                  ;									  
 17072                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 17073                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 17074                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17075                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 17076                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 17077                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 17078                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 17079                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 17080                                  ;									  
 17081                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 17082                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 17083                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 17084                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 17085                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 17086                                  ;									  
 17087                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 17088                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 17089                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 17090                                  ;									  
 17091                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 17092                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 17093                                  ;									  
 17094                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 17095                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 17096                                  ;									  
 17097                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 17098                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 17099                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 17100                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 17101                                  ;						called. 		  
 17102                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 17103                                  ;									  
 17104                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17105                                  ;									  
 17106                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17107                                  ;									  
 17108                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17109                                  ;									  
 17110                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17111                                  ;									  
 17112                                  
 17113                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 17114                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 17115 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 17116 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 17117                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 17118 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17119 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17120 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 17121 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 17122                                  endstruc					  
 17123                                  									  
 17124                                  ;FeatureByte1	bit map equates 					  
 17125                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 17126                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 17127                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 17128                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 17129                                  					;;End of Modification

 17231                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17232                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17233                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17234                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17235                                  
 17236                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 17237                                  ;
 17238                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 17239                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 17240                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 17241                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 17242                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 17243                                  ;
 17244                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 17245                                  ;
 17246                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 17247                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 17248                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 17249                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 17250                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 17251                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 17252                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 17253                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 17254                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 17255                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 17256                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 17257                                  
 17258                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 17259                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 17260                                  
 17261                                  struc 		curdir_list
 17262                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17263 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 17264 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 17265 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 17266 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 17267 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 17268 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 17269                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 17270 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 17271 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 17272 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 17273                                  .size:
 17274                                  endstruc
 17275                                  
 17276                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 17277                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 17278                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 17279                                  						; argument
 17280                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 17281

 17283                                  
 17284                                  ;Flag word masks
 17285                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17286                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17287                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 17288                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 17289                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 17291                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17292                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17293                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17294                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17295                                  
 17296                                  ; system file table
 17297                                  
 17298                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 17299                                  ;
 17300                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 17301                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 17302                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 17303                                  
 17304                                  struc	SF
 17305 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 17306 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 17307 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 17308                                  .size:
 17309                                  endstruc
 17310                                  
 17311                                  ;**	System file table entry
 17312                                  ;
 17313                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 17314                                  
 17315                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 17316 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 17317                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 17318 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 17319 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 17320 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 17321                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 17322                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 17323                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 17324                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 17325                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 17326                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 17327                                  					;   (WRITE)
 17328                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 17329                                  					;
 17330                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 17331                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 17332                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 17333                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 17334                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 17335                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 17336                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 17337                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 17338                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 17339                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 17340                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 17341                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 17342 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 17343                                  					; to device header if local device,
 17344                                  					; points to net device header if
 17345                                  					; remote
 17346 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 17347                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 17348 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 17349 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 17350 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 17351 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 17352                                  ;
 17353                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 17354                                  ; ID
 17355                                  ;
 17356 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 17357 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 17358 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 17359                                  ;
 17360                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 17361                                  ;
 17362 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 17363                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 17364                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 17365                                  					; disk changed errors.
 17366                                  ; SHARING INFO
 17367 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 17368 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 17369 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 17370 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 17371 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 17372 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 17373                                  .size:
 17374                                  endstruc

 17645                                  SYSINIT$:
 17646                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 17647                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions
 17648                                  	; include STKMES.INC	;Fatal stack error message
 17649                                  	;   public Endstackcode

 17652                                  
 17653                                  ; 05/07/2018
 17654                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17655                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17656                                  
 17657                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17658                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 17659                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17660                                  
 17661                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 17662                                  ;
 17663                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 17664                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 17665                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 17666                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 17667                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 17668                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 17669                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 17670                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 17671                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 17672                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 17673                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 17674                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 17675                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 17676                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 17677                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 17678                                  ;
 17679                                  
 17680                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 17681                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 17682                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 17683                                  ;
 17684                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 17685                                  ;
 17686                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 17687                                  ;
 17688                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 17689                                  ;
 17690                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 17691                                  ;
 17692                                  
 17693                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 17694                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 17695                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 17696                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 17697                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 17698                                  ;      deeply nested one
 17699                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 17700                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 17701                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 17702                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 17703                                  
 17704                                  		;EVEN
 17705                                  ;align 2
 17706                                  		; 21/10/2022
 17707                                  
 17708 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 17709 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 17710 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 17711 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 17712 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 17713 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 17714                                  
 17715 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 17716 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17717 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17718                                  
 17719                                  ;***********************************************************************
 17720                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 17721                                  
 17722                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17723                                  
 17724 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 17725                                  
 17726                                  int02:
 17727                                  
 17728                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17729                                  ;
 17730                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 17731                                  ;
 17732                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 17733                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 17734                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 17735                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 17736                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 17737                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 17738                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 17739                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 17740                                  ;
 17741                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 17742                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 17743                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 17744                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 17745                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 17746                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 17747                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 17748                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 17749                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 17750                                  ;
 17751                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17752                                  
 17753 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 17754 00000017 06                      	push	es
 17755 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 17756 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17757                                  	; 02/11/2022
 17758 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 17759 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 17760 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 17761                                  
 17762 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 17763                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 17764                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 17765                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 17766                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 17767 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 17768 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 17769                                  special02:
 17770 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 17771 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 17772                                  normal02:
 17773 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 17774 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 17775 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02
 17776

 17997 00000144 [3101]                  	dw	old77
 17998                                  intret_77:
 17999 00000146 CF                      	iret
 18000                                  
 18001                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18002                                  
 18003                                  ;********************************************************************
 18004                                  ;common routines
 18005                                  ;********************************************************************
 18006                                  
 18007                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 18008                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 18009                                  ; service routine
 18010                                  
 18011                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 18012                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18013                                  
 18014                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 18015                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 18016                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 18017                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 18018                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 18019                                  
 18020                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 18021                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 18022                                  
 18023                                  do_int_stacks:
 18024 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 18025 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 18026 00000149 06                      	push	es
 18027 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 18028 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 18029 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 18030                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18031                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 18032                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18033 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 18034 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 18035 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 18036                                  
 18037 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 18038                                  
 18039                                  found02:
 18040 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 18041 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 18042                                  
 18043 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 18044                                  
 18045 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 18046                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18047                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 18048                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18049                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 18050 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 18051 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 18052                                  
 18053                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 18054 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 18055 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 18056 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 18057 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 18058 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 18059 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 18060 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18061 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 18062                                  
 18063                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 18064                                  	;push    bp
 18065                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 18066                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 18067                                  	;pop     bp
 18068                                  	;push    es
 18069                                  	;pop     ss
 18070                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 18071                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 18072                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18073                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 18074                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 18075                                  
 18076 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 18077                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18078 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 18079                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18080                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 18081                                  
 18082 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 18083                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18084 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 18085                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18086                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 18087 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 18088 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 18089                                  
 18090                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18091                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 18092                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18093 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 18094 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 18095                                  
 18096 000001A8 07                      	pop	es
 18097 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 18098 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 18099 000001AB 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 18100 000001AE CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 18101                                  
 18102                                  notfree02:
 18103 000001AF 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 18104 000001B1 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 18105                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18106                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 18107                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18108 000001B3 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18109                                  
 18110                                  findnext02:
 18111 000001B7 E81200                  	call	longpath
 18112 000001BA EBA8                    	jmp	short found02
 18113                                  
 18114                                  foundbad02:
 18115 000001BC 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18116 000001C1 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 18117 000001C3 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 18118                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18119                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 18120                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18121 000001C5 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 18122 000001CA EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 18123                                  
 18124                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18125                                  
 18126                                  ; Common routines
 18127                                  
 18128                                  longpath:
 18129                                  	; 21/03/2019
 18130 000001CC 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 18131                                  lploopp:
 18132                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18133                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 18134                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18135 000001D1 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 18136 000001D6 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 18137                                  
 18138 000001D8 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 18139                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18140                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 18141                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18142 000001DA 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18143 000001DE 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 18144 000001E0 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 18145                                  
 18146 000001E2 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 18147 000001E4 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 18148                                  
 18149                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18150                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 18151                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18152 000001E6 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 18153                                  inuse:
 18154 000001EA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18155 000001EF 7406                    	je	short fatal
 18156 000001F1 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 18157 000001F4 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 18158                                  found:
 18159 000001F6 C3                      	retn
 18160                                  fatal:
 18161 000001F7 1E                      	push	ds
 18162 000001F8 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 18163 000001FB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18164 000001FD 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 18165 00000202 1F                      	pop	ds
 18166 00000203 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 18167                                  
 18168 00000205 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 18169 00000207 E672                    	out	72h,al
 18170                                  
 18171                                  skip_nmis:
 18172 00000209 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 18173 0000020A B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 18174 0000020C E621                    	out	021h,al
 18175 0000020E E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 18176                                  
 18177 00000210 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 18178 00000212 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 18179 00000214 BE[3B02]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 18180                                  ;SR;
 18181                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 18182                                  ;
 18183 00000217 50                      	push	ax
 18184 00000218 1E                      	push	ds
 18185                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 18186                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 18187                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18188 00000219 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 18189 0000021C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18190                                  
 18191                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 18192 0000021E F606[6F08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 18193 00000223 1F                      	pop	ds
 18194 00000224 58                      	pop	ax
 18195 00000225 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 18196                                  
 18197                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 18198                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 18199                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18200 00000227 9A[7008]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 18201                                  ;
 18202                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 18203                                  ;
 18204                                  fatal_loop:
 18205 0000022C AC                      	lodsb
 18206 0000022D 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 18207 0000022F 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 18208                                  
 18209 00000231 B307                    	mov	bl,7
 18210 00000233 B40E                    	mov	ah,14
 18211 00000235 CD10                    	int	10h			; whoops, this enables ints
 18212 00000237 EBF3                    	jmp	short fatal_loop
 18213

 18215 00000239 EBFE                    	jmp	short fatal_done

 19465                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 19466                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 19467                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 19468                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 19469                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 19470                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 19471                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 19472                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 19473                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 19474                                  ;
 19475                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 19476                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 19477                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 19478                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 19479                                  ; been patched.
