 19795                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 19796                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 19797                                  ;   which follow....)
 19798                                  
 19799                                  retry:
 19800 00000779 BA[AB45]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 19801                                  
 19802                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 19803                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 19804                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 19805                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 19806                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 19807                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 19808                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 19809                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 19810                                  
 19811                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 19812                                  
 19813 0000077C 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 19814 0000077D BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19815 00000780 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 19816 00000782 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 19817 00000784 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 19818 00000786 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 19819 00000788 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 19820                                  
 19821 0000078A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19822 0000078C B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 19823 0000078E CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 19824 00000790 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 19825                                  
 19826                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 19827                                  
 19828                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 19829                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 19830                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 19831                                  
 19832                                  	; 22/10/2022
 19833                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 19834 00000792 8B1E[9402]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 19835 00000796 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 19836                                  
 19837                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 19838                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 19839                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 19840                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 19841                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 19842                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 19843                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 19844                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 19845                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 19846                                  ;
 19847                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 19848                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 19849                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 19850                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 19851                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 19852                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 19853                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 19854                                  
 19855                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 19856                                  	; (SYSINIT:0858h)

 19858 0000079C E303                            jcxz	no_env		; use config_wrkseg only if there's env data

 19861                                  	; 22/10/2022

 20270                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 20271                                  ;
 20272                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 20273                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 20274                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 20275                                  ;
 20276                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow

 20695                                  
 20696                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20697                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20698                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20699                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20700                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20701                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20702                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20703                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20704                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20705                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20706                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20707                                  ;
 20708                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20709                                  
 20710                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20711                                  update_arena:
 20712 00000A10 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20713 00000A11 57                      	push	di
 20714 00000A12 51                      	push	cx
 20715 00000A13 52                      	push	dx
 20716                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20717                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20718                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20719                                  	; ds = cs 
 20720 00000A14 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20721 00000A18 4F                      	dec	di
 20722 00000A19 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20723                                  						;  before sysvar
 20724 00000A1A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20725                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20726 00000A1C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20727 00000A21 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20728 00000A23 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20729                                  
 20730                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20731 00000A25 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20732 00000A2A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20733 00000A2C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20734 00000A2E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20735 00000A30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20736                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20737 00000A32 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20738                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20739 00000A36 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20740 00000A3C 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20741                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20742 00000A3E 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20743 00000A42 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20744                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20745                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 20746 00000A44 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20747 00000A47 5A                      	pop	dx
 20748 00000A48 59                      	pop	cx
 20749 00000A49 5F                      	pop	di
 20750 00000A4A 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 20751 00000A4B C3                      	retn
 20752                                  ;
 20753                                  ; M012 : END
 20754                                  ;
 20755                                  FatalErr:
 20756 00000A4C 0E                      	push	cs
 20757 00000A4D 1F                      	pop	ds

 20759 00000A51 B409                    	mov	ah,9

 20763 00000A55 E92C07                  	jmp	stall

 20765                                  	;cli
 20766                                  	;hlt

 20770                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20771                                  
 20772                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20773                                  ;
 20774                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20775                                  ;
 20776                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20777                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20778                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20779                                  ;
 20780                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20781                                  ;
 20782                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20783                                  
 20784                                  AllocHMA:
 20785                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20786                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20787                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20788                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20789                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20790                                  
 20791                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20792                                  ;
 20793                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20794                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20795                                  ;	push	ax
 20796                                  ;	popf
 20797                                  ;	pushf
 20798                                  ;	pop	ax
 20799                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20800                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20801                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20802                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20803                                  
 20804                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20805                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20806                                  
 20807 00000A58 1E                      	push	ds

 20942                                  
 20943                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20944                                  ;
 20945                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20946                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20947                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20948                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20949                                  ;
 20950                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20951                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20952                                  ;
 20953                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20954                                  
 20955                                  StartVDHead:
 20956                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20957                                  
 20958 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20959 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20960 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20961 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20962 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20963                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20964 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20965                                  VDiskSig1:
 20966 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20967                                  
 20968                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20969                                  
 20970 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20971                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20972 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20973 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20974 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20975                                  VDInt19:
 20976 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20977                                  OldVDInt19:
 20978 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20979                                  
 20980                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20981                                  
 20982                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20983 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20984                                  VDiskSig2:
 20985 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20986                                  
 20987                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20988                                  
 20989 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20990 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20991 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20992 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20993 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20994 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20995 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20996 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20997 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20998 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20999 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 21000 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 21001 00000B22 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 21002                                  
 21003                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 21004                                  
 21005                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21006                                  ;
 21007                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 21008                                  ;
 21009                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 21010                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 21011                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 21012                                  ;
 21013                                  ; Inputs : None
 21014                                  ;
 21015                                  ; Outputs : None
 21016                                  ;
 21017                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 21018                                  ;
 21019                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21020                                  
 21021                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21022                                  
 21023                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 21024 00000B24 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21025 00000B26 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 21026                                  
 21027                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 21028                                  
 21029                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21030 00000B28 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 21031                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 21032 00000B2B 2EA3[000B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 21033 00000B2F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 21034                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21035 00000B32 2EA3[020B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21036                                  
 21037                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 21038                                  
 21039 00000B36 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 21040                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 21041                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21042 00000B38 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 21043 00000B3B CD21                    	int	21h
 21044                                  
 21045                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 21046                                  
 21047 00000B3D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 21048 00000B3E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21049                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 21050 00000B40 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 21051                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 21052 00000B47 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 21053 00000B4E 40                      	inc	ax
 21054 00000B4F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 21055                                  
 21056                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 21057                                  
 21058 00000B51 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 21059                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 21060 00000B52 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 21061 00000B58 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 21062                                  
 21063                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 21064                                  
 21065                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 21066 00000B5B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 21067 00000B5E BE[D00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 21068 00000B61 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 21069 00000B63 0E                      	push	cs
 21070 00000B64 1F                      	pop	ds
 21071 00000B65 FC                      	cld
 21072 00000B66 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 21073 00000B68 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 21074                                  
 21075                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 21076                                  
 21077                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21078 00000B69 57                      	push	di
 21079 00000B6A 06                      	push	es
 21080                                  
 21081                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 21082                                  	;mov	es,ax
 21083                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21084 00000B6B 49                      	dec	cx
 21085                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 21086 00000B6C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 21087                                  
 21088 00000B6E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 21089                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 21090 00000B71 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 21091 00000B74 BE[040B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 21092 00000B77 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 21093                                  
 21094 00000B79 5F                      	pop	di
 21095 00000B7A 07                      	pop	es
 21096                                  
 21097 00000B7B C3                      	retn
 21098                                  
 21099                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21100                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 21101                                  ;
 21102                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 21103                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 21104                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 21105                                  ;
 21106                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21107                                  
 21108                                  struc desc
 21109 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 21110 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 21111 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 21112 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 21113 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 21114                                   .size:
 21115                                  endstruc
 21116                                  
 21117                                  		; 23/10/2022
 21118                                  bmove:		;label byte
 21119                                  
 21120                                  dummy:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21121 00000B7C 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0		 
 21122                                  gdt:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21123 00000B84 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 21124 00000B8C FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 21125 00000B8E 0000                    		dw	0
 21126 00000B90 00                      		db	0
 21127 00000B91 93                      		db	93h
 21128 00000B92 0000                    		dw	0
 21129 00000B94 FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB
 21130 00000B96 0000                    		dw	0
 21131 00000B98 10                      		db	10h
 21132 00000B99 93                      		db	93h
 21133 00000B9A 0000                    		dw	0
 21134                                  
 21135                                  rombios_code:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21136 00000B9C 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 21137                                  temp_stack:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21138 00000BA4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 21139                                  
 21140 00000BAC 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 21141                                  
 21142                                  
 21143                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 21144                                  
 21145                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21146                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 21147                                  
 21148                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 21149                                  
 21150                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 21151                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21152                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 21153                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 21154                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 21155                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 21156                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 21157                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 21158                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 21159                                  ;								      ;I070
 21160                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 21161                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 21162                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 21163                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 21164                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 21165                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 21166                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 21167                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 21168                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 21169                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 21170                                  ;								      ;I070
 21171                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 21172                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21173                                  
 21174                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21175                                  	; ds = cs
 21176                                  
 21177                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21178                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 21179                                  
 21180 00000BCC 06                      	push	es
 21181 00000BCD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 21182 00000BCF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 21183 00000BD1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 21184 00000BD3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 21185 00000BD5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21186 00000BD7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 21187 00000BD9 05[AC0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 21188 00000BDC 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 21189                                  
 21190                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 21191                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 21192                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 21193                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 21194                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 21195                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21196                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 21197 00000BDF A3[8E0B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 21198                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 21199 00000BE2 8816[900B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 21200                                  
 21201 00000BE6 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 21202 00000BE9 0E                      	push	cs
 21203 00000BEA 07                      	pop	es
 21204 00000BEB BE[7C0B]                	mov	si,bmove
 21205 00000BEE B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 21206 00000BF0 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 21207                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 21208                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 21209                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 21210 00000BF2 07                      	pop	es
 21211 00000BF3 C3                      	retn

 21214                                  ;
 21215                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 21216                                  ;
 21217                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 21218                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 21219                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 21220                                  ;		the offset.
 21221                                  ;
 21222                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 21223                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 21224                                  ;
 21225                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21226                                  
 21227                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 21228                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21229 00000BF4 1E                      	push	ds
 21230 00000BF5 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 21231 00000BF8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21232                                  	;
 21233 00000BFA 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 21234 00000BFC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 21235                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21236 00000BFF A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 21237                                  	;
 21238 00000C02 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 21239 00000C04 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 21240 00000C07 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 21241 00000C0A B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21242 00000C0C D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 21243 00000C0E 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 21244                                  	;
 21245                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21246                                  	;push	ds
 21247                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 21248                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 21249                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21250                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21251                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 21252                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 21253 00000C10 893E[9508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21254                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 21255 00000C14 1F                      	pop	ds
 21256 00000C15 C3                      	retn
 21257                                  
 21258                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21259                                  ;
 21260                                  ; procedure : IsVDiskInstalled
 21261                                  ;
 21262                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 21263                                  ;		& INT 19 vector
 21264                                  ;
 21265                                  ; Inputs  : A20 flag should be ON
 21266                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared
 21267                                  ;
 21268                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21269                                  
 21270                                  IsVDiskInstalled:
 21271 00000C16 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax

 21274                                  	;mov	si,VDiskSig1-StartVDHead ; 12h
 21275                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21276 00000C1E BE1200                  	mov	si,12h ; 18
 21277                                  	;mov	cx,VLEN1 ; 5
 21278 00000C21 B90500                  	mov	cx,5
 21279 00000C24 0E                      	push	cs
 21280 00000C25 07                      	pop	es
 21281 00000C26 BF[E20A]                	mov	di,VDiskSig1
 21282 00000C29 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 21283 00000C2B 740F                    	je	short ivdins_retn
 21284 00000C2D B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 21285 00000C30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21286                                  	;mov	si,10h+(VDiskSig2-VDiskHMAHead) ; 13h
 21287 00000C32 BE1300                  	mov	si,13h
 21288 00000C35 BF[070B]                	mov	di,VDiskSig2
 21289                                  	;;mov	cx,VLEN2  ; 5
 21290                                  	;mov	cx,5
 21291                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21292 00000C38 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 21293 00000C3A F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 21294                                  ivdins_retn: 
 21295 00000C3C C3                      	retn			; returns the Zero flag

 21297                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21298                                  ;
 21299                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 21300                                  ;
 21301                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 21302                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 21303                                  ;
 21304                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21305                                  
 21306                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21307                                  CPMHack:
 21308 00000C3D 1E                      	push	ds
 21309 00000C3E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 21310 00000C41 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 21311                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 21312                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21313 00000C43 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 21314 00000C44 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 21315 00000C46 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 21316 00000C49 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 21317                                  	;mov	cx,5
 21318 00000C4C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 21319 00000C4E FC                      	cld
 21320 00000C4F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 21321 00000C51 1F                      	pop	ds
 21322 00000C52 C3                      	retn
 21323

 21333 00000C59 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21334 00000C5B C3                      	retn

 21424                                  
 21425                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 21426                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 21427                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to
 21428                                  ;	0 out curdir_flags,curdir_devptr of cds so ibmdos can issue
 21429                                  ;	"invalid drive specification" message when the user try to
 21430                                  ;	access them.
 21431                                  ;
 21432                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 21433                                  ;	(es:di) = CURDIR_FLAGS in the CDS records
 21434                                  ;	(ds:si) = Next DPB (-1 if none)
 21435                                  
 21436 00000CA6 83FEFF                  	cmp	si,-1	; cmp si,0FFFFh
 21437 00000CA9 7413                    	je	short fooset_zero	; don't have any physical drive.
 21438                                  
 21439                                  ;	check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not go to normcds.
 21440                                  ;	if we are faking floppy drives then see if this cds being initialised
 21441                                  ;	is for drive a: or b: by checking the appropriate field in the dpb
 21442                                  ;	pointed to by ds:si. if not for a: or b: then go to normcds. if
 21443                                  ;	for a: or b: then execute the code given below starting at fooset_zero.
 21444                                  ;	for dpb offsets look at inc\dpb.inc.
 21445                                  
 21446                                  	; 03/09/2023

 21448

 21450                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:fake_floppy_drv],1
 21451 00000CB1 7512                    	jne	short normcds 		; machine has floppy drives
 21452                                  	;cmp	byte [si+DPB.drive],1	; if dpb_drive = 0 (a) or 1 (b).
 21453                                  	;cmp	byte [si],1
 21454 00000CB3 380C                    	cmp	[si],cl ; 1 ; 03/09/2023
 21455 00000CB5 770E                    	ja	short normcds
 21456 00000CB7 B103                    	mov	cl,3			; the next dbp pointer
 21457                                  					; AX should be zero here
 21458 00000CB9 F3AB                    	rep	stosw
 21459 00000CBB 59                      	pop	cx
 21460 00000CBC EB17                    	jmp	short get_next_dpb
 21461                                  
 21462                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 21463                                  
 21464                                  fooset_zero:

 21471                                  ;

 21476                                  normcds:

 21479                                  ;	if a non-fat based media is detected (by dpb.numberoffat == 0), then
 21480                                  ;	set curdir_flags to 0. this is for signaling ibmdos and ifsfunc that

 21490                                  	;mov	ax,4000h

 21496 00000CD4 AB                      	stosw
 21497                                  
 21498                                  get_next_dpb:				; entry point for fake_fooset_zero
 21499                                  	; 30/12/2022
 21500                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT:0DD1h)
 21501                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21502                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)

 21542 00000CF3 C534                    	lds	si,[si]

 21544                                  
 21545                                  get_dpb_for_drive_1:
 21546                                  	;cmp	al,[si+DPB.DRIVE]	; match?
 21547 00000CF7 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si]

 21549                                  
 21550 00000CFB C57419                  	lds	si,[si+DPB.NEXT_DPB] ; [si+19h]
 21551 00000CFE 83FEFF                  	cmp	si,-1

 22223                                  
 22224                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 22225                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 22226                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 22227                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 22228                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 22229                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 22230                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 22231                                  ;
 22232                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 22233                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 22234                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 22235                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 22236                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 22237                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 22238                                  ;
 22239                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 22240                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 22241                                  ;
 22242                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 22243                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 22244                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 22245                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 22246                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 22247                                  ;
 22248                                  ;	for round-up machine
 22249                                  ;
 22250                                  ;			  none.
 22251                                  
 22252                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 22253                                  ;
 22254                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 22255                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 22256                                  
 22257                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22258                                  
 22259 00000FE5 50                      	push	ax
 22260 00000FE6 53                      	push	bx
 22261 00000FE7 52                      	push	dx

 22264 00000FE9 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port
 22265 00000FEB BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 22266 00000FEE EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 22267 00000FEF 42                      	inc	dx

 22269 00000FF1 42                      	inc	dx

 22271 00000FF3 42                      	inc	dx
 22272 00000FF4 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f5h,0ffh
 22273 00000FF5 42                      	inc	dx
 22274 00000FF6 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f6h,0ffh
 22275 00000FF7 42                      	inc	dx

 22298 00001015 BAF206                  	mov	dx,6F2h 		;get starting address

 22300 00001019 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 22301 0000101A EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f3h,0ffh
 22302 0000101B 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address

 22304 0000101D 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 22305 0000101E 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address

 22463                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22464                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22465                                  ;
 22466                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22467                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22468                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22469                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22470                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22471                                  ; program).
 22472                                  
 22473                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22474                                  
 22475                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22476                                  
 22477 000010CD 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22478                                  
 22479                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22480                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22481                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22482                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22483                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22484                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22485                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22486                                  ; carridge return.
 22487                                  
 22488                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22489                                  ;character after =.

 22615                                  %if 0

 22617                                  	;retn		; retn (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h) ; 18/12/2022
 22618                                  
 22619                                  	; 24/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 22620                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 22621                                  	mov     ah,4Dh
 22622                                  	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 22623                                  	cmp     ah,3
 22624                                  	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 22625                                  	call    error_line
 22626                                  	stc
 22627                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 22628                                  	retn		
 22629                                  
 22630                                  %endif ; 24/10/2022

 22632                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22633                                  
 22634                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22635                                  ;
 22636                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22637                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22638                                  ;
 22639                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22640                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22641                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22642                                  
 22643                                  ParaRound:
 22644 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22645 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22646 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22647 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22648 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22649 00001156 C3                      	retn
 22650                                  
 22651                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22652                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22653                                  ;
 22654                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22655                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22656                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22657                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22658                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22659                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22660                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22661                                  ;
 22662                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22663                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22664                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22665                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22666                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22667                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22668                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22669                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22670                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22671                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22672                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22673                                  ;
 22674                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22675                                  
 22676                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22677                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22678                                  sysinit_base:				
 22679 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22680 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22681 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22682 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22683 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22684 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22685 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22686 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22687                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22688                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22689 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22690 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22691 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22692                                  
 22693                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22694                                  
 22695 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22696 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 22697 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 22698                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22699                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22700                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22701 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22702                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22703 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 22704                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22705                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22706                                  
 22707                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22708                                  stall:
 22709                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22710                                  _stall: 
 22711                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22712 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 22713                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22714                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22715 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22716                                  
 22717                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22718 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22719                                  
 22720                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22721                                  
 22722                                  sum_up:
 22723                                  
 22724                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22725                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22726                                  ;
 22727                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22728                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22729                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22730                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22731                                  ;
 22732                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22733                                  
 22734 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 22735                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22736                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22737 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22738                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22739                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22740 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22741 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22742 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22743 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22744                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22745 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22746 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22747                                  sum1:
 22748 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22749 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 22750 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 22751 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22752                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22753                                  sum_sys_code:
 22754                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22755 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22756                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22757                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22758                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22759                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22760                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22761                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22762                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22763 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22764 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22765 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22766                                  sum2:
 22767 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22768 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 22769 000011B4 46                      	inc	si
 22770 000011B5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22771 000011B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 22772 000011B8 C3                      	retn
 22773                                  
 22774                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22775                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22776                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22777                                  
 22778                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22779                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22780 000011B9 0000                    	dw	0
 22781                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22782                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22783 000011BB 0000                    	dw	0	
 22784                                  
 22785                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 22786                                  
 22787                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 22788

 22791 000011BF 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'

 22798                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22799                                  ;
 22800                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22801                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22802                                  ;
 22803                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22804                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22805                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22806                                  ;
 22807                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22808                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22809                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 22814                                  set_buffer:
 22815 000011D8 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22816 000011DA E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22817 000011DD 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 22818                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 22819                                  	; 17/09/2023
 22820 000011DF FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 22821                                  set_buff_1:
 22822                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22823                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 22824 000011E1 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 22825                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 22826 000011E3 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 22827                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 22828 000011E6 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22829                                  
 22830 000011EB 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22831 000011ED 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22832 000011F2 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22833                                  
 22834                                  ;	for each buffer
 22835                                  
 22836                                  nxt_buff:
 22837 000011F3 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22838 000011F6 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 22839 000011F8 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 22840                                  
 22841 000011FA 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22842                                  
 22843 000011FF 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 22844                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22845 00001200 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22846 00001203 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22847                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22848                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22849 00001205 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 22850                                  
 22851 00001209 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 22852 0000120B 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 22853                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 22854 0000120D C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22855 00001211 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22856                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 22857 00001215 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 22858                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 22859 0000121A 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 22860 0000121D 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 22861                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 22862                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 22863 00001221 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22864                                  set_buff_2:
 22865 00001224 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22866                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22867 00001229 2E800E[BD14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 22868                                  	;call	round
 22869                                  	;retn
 22870                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22871 0000122F E93D30                  	jmp	round

 22873                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22874                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22875                                  ;
 22876                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22877                                  ;
 22878                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22879                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22880                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22881                                  
 22882                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22883                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22884 00001232 53                      	push	bx
 22885 00001233 52                      	push	dx
 22886 00001234 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22887 00001238 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22888                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22889 0000123D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22890                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22891                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22892                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22893 00001240 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22894 00001242 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22895 00001244 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22896                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22897 00001247 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22898 00001249 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22899 0000124C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22900                                  	
 22901                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22902                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22903                                  	; zf=1
 22904 0000124E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22905                                  	; zf=1
 22906                                  	
 22907                                  	;zf=1
 22908                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22909                                  	;zf=1
 22910 0000124F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22911                                  got_hma:
 22912 00001254 5A                      	pop	dx
 22913 00001255 5B                      	pop	bx
 22914 00001256 C3                      	retn

 22934                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax

 22937 0000126C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh

 22939 00001272 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0

 22941 00001278 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 22944                                  ; ======================================================================
 22945                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22946                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22947                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22948                                  
 22949                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22950                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22951                                  ;
 22952                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22953                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22954                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22955                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22956                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22957                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22958                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22959                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22960                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22961                                  ;
 22962                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22963                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22964                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22965                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22966                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22967                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22968                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22969                                  ;	conditions:
 22970                                  ;
 22971                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22972                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22973                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22974                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22975                                  ;
 22976                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22977                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22978                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22979                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22980                                  ;
 22981                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22982                                  ;
 22983                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22984                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22985                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22986                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22987                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22988                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22989                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22990                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22991                                  ;
 22992                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22993                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22994                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22995                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22996                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22997                                  ;
 22998                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22999                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 23000                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 23001                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 23002                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 23003                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 23004                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 23005                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 23006                                  ;
 23007                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 23008                                  
 23009                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23010                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 23011                                  
 23012                                  	; 14/12/2022
 23013                                  stackinit:
 23014 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 23015 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 23016 00001281 06                      	push	es
 23017 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 23018 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 23019 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 23020 00001285 57                      	push	di
 23021 00001286 56                      	push	si
 23022 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 23023                                  
 23024                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 23025                                  
 23026                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23027                                  	; ds = cs
 23028 00001288 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 23029 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 23030                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23031                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 23032                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 23033 0000128D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 23034                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 23035 00001291 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 23036 00001294 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 23037                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23038 00001298 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 23039                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23040                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 23041                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 23042 0000129B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 23043                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23044 0000129F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 23045 000012A1 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 23046                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23047                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 23048                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 23049 000012A4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 23050                                  
 23051                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 23052                                  
 23053                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 23054                                  
 23055                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 23056                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23057                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 23058 000012A8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 23059                                  
 23060                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 23061                                  
 23062 000012AD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 23063                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 23064                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23065                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
