 23851                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23852                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23853                                  
 23854                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23855                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23856                                  
 23857                                  new_init_loop:
 23858                                  
 23859                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23860                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23861                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23862                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23863                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23864                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23865                                  
 23866 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23867 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23868 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23869 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23870                                  
 23871 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 23872                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23873                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23874                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23875 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23876 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23877 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23878 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23879 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23880 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23881 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 23882                                  
 23883 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23884 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23885 00001497 C3                      	retn
 23886                                  
 23887                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23888                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23889

 23893                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23894                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23895                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23896                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23897                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.

 24152                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 24153                                  
 24154                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24155                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 24156                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 24157                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 24158                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 24159                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 24160                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 24161                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 24162                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 24163                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 24164                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 24165                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24166                                  
 24167                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 24168                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 24169 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 24170 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 24171 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 24172                                  endstruc
 24173                                  
 24174                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24175                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 24176                                  ;
 24177                                  ;
 24178                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 24179                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 24180                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24181                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24182                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24183                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24184                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24185                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24186                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24187                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24188                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24189                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 24190                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 24191                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 24192                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 24193                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 24194                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 24195                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 24196                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 24197                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 24198                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 24199                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 24200                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 24201                                  ;	   :
 24202                                  ;
 24203                                  ;Note:
 24204                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 24205                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 24206                                  ;
 24207                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 24208                                  ;
 24209                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 24210                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 24211                                  ;
 24212                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 24213                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 24214                                  ;
 24215                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 24216                                  ;
 24217                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 24218                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 24219                                  ;
 24220                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24221                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 24222                                  ;
 24223                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 24224                                  ;
 24225                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24226                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 24227                                  ;
 24228                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24229                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24230                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24231                                  ;
 24232                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 24233                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 24234                                  ;
 24235                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 24236                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 24237                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 24238                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24239                                  
 24240                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 24241                                  
 24242                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 24243                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 24244                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 24245                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 24246                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 24247                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 24248                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 24249                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 24250                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 24251                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 24252                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 24253                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 24254                                  
 24255                                  ;**** Function flags
 24256                                  
 24257                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 24258                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 24259                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 24260                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 24261                                  
 24262                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 24263                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 24264 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 24265 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 24266 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 24267 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 24268 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 24269 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 24270                                  endstruc
 24271                                  
 24272                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24273                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 24274                                  ;
 24275                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 24276                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 24277                                  ;	     +-
 24278                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 24279                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 24280                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 24281                                  ;	     |	:
 24282                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24283                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 24284                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 24285                                  ;	     |	:
 24286                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24287                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 24288                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 24289                                  ;	     +-	:
 24290                                  ;
 24291                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 24292                                  ;
 24293                                  ;Note:
 24294                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 24295                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 24296                                  ;
 24297                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24298                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24299                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24300                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24301                                  
 24302                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 24303                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 24304                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 24305                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 24306                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 24307                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 24308                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 24309                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 24310                                  
 24311                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 24312 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 24313 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 24314 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 24315 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 24316 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 24317                                  endstruc
 24318                                  
 24319                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24320                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 24321                                  ;
 24322                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 24323                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 24324                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 24325                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 24326                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 24327                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 24328                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 24329                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24330                                  ;
 24331                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24332                                  ;
 24333                                  ;            +-
 24334                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24335                                  ;	    | or
 24336                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24337                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24338                                  ;	    | or
 24339                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24340                                  ;	    | or
 24341                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24342                                  ;	    | or
 24343                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24344                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24345                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24346                                  ;	    | or
 24347                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24348                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24349                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24350                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24351                                  ;	    +-
 24352                                  ;
 24353                                  ;
 24354                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24355                                  ;      list.
 24356                                  ;
 24357                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24358                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24359                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24360                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24361                                  
 24362                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 24363                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 24364 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 24365 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 24366 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24367 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24368                                  endstruc
 24369

 24375                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 24376                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 24377                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 24378                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 24379                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 24380                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 24381                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 24382                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 24383

 24387                                  ;

 24389

 24391                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 24392                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 24393                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 24394                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 24395                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 24396                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 24397                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24398                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 24399                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24481                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 24483                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24484                                  
 24485                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24486                                  ; SysParse;
 24487                                  ;
 24488                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24489                                  ;
 24490                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24491                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24492                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24493                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24494                                  ;
 24495                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24496                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24497                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24498                                  ;
 24499                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24500                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24501                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24502                                  ;
 24503                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24504                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24505                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24506                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24507                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24508                                  ;
 24509                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24510                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24511                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24512                                  ;
 24513                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24514                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24515                                  ;
 24516                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24517                                  ;
 24518                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24519                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24520                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24521                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24522                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24523                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24524                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24525                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24526                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24527                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24528                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24529                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24530                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24531                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24532                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24533                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24534                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24535                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24536                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24537                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24538                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24539                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24540                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24541                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24542                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24543                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24544                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24545                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24546                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24547                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24548                                  
 24549                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24550                                  
 24551                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24552                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24553                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24554                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24555                                  
 24556                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)

 24573                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter

 25182                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25183                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 25184                                  ;
 25185                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 25186                                  ;
 25187                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 25188                                  ;	    AL = type
 25189                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 25190                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 25191                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 25192                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 25193                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 25194                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 25195                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 25196                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25197                                  ;
 25198                                  ; Output:   None
 25199                                  ;
 25200                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 25201                                  ;
 25202                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 25203                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25204                                  
 25205                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 25206 0000177B 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25207 0000177C 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 25208                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 25209 00001780 2E893E[C914]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 25210                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 25211                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 25212                                  	; 07/09/2023
 25213                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 25214 00001785 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 25215                                  
 25216 00001788 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25217 00001789 2EA1[D814]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 25218 0000178D 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 25219                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 25220 00001791 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25221                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 25222 00001792 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 25223 00001794 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 25224                                  
 25225                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;
 25226 00001796 26895504                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val],dx ;AN000; then store 32bit

 25229

 25232 000017A2 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RLT01		;AN000;
 25233

 25235                                  					;AN000; then store list index
 25236 000017A8 EB50                    	jmp	short _$P_RLT_Exit	;AN000;
 25237                                  
 25238                                  _$P_RLT01:				;AN000;
 25239 000017AA 3C07                    	cmp	al,_$P_Date_F		;AN000; Date format ?
 25240 000017AC 74E8                    	je	short _$P_RLT02		;AN000;
 25241

 25243 000017B0 74E4                    	je	short _$P_RLT02		;AN000;
 25244                                  
 25245 000017B2 3C06                    	cmp	al,_$P_Drive		;AN000; drive format ?
 25246 000017B4 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RLT03		;AN000;

 25250

 25253 000017BE 750F                    	jne	short _$P_RLT05		;AN000;

 25256 000017C4 40                      	inc	ax			;AN000; skip left Parentheses

 25283                                  _$P_RLT_CAP01:				;AN000;

 25294                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25295                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 25296                                  ;
 25297                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 25298                                  ;	     result buffer
 25299                                  ;
 25300                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 25301                                  ;		Complex
 25302                                  ;		Date
 25303                                  ;		Time
 25304                                  ;		Drive
 25305                                  ;		Filespec
 25306                                  ;		Quoted String

 25599                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25600                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25601                                  ;
 25602                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25603                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25604                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25605                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25606                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25607                                  ;
 25608                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25609                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25610                                  ;
 25611                                  ; Output:    None
 25612                                  ;
 25613                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25614                                  ;
 25615                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25616                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25617                                  
 25618                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25619                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25620                                  
 25621                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25622                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25623                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25624 0000192A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25625 0000192B 2E800E[D114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25626 00001931 2E8026[D114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25627                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25628 00001937 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25629 0000193A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25630 0000193C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25631                                  
 25632 0000193E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25633 00001940 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25634                                  
 25635 00001942 2E800E[D114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25636                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25637 00001948 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25638                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25639 00001949 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25640 0000194C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25641 0000194D C3                      	retn
 25642                                  
 25643                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25644                                  
 25645                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25646                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 25647                                  
 25648                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25649                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 25650 0000194E 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25651 0000194F 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25652 00001950 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25653 00001951 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25654 00001952 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 25655 00001954 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 25656 00001956 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 25657                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 25658 00001957 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25659 0000195A 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 25660 0000195C 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 25661                                  
 25662 0000195E E8E000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 25663 00001961 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 25664                                  
 25665 00001963 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 25666 00001965 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 25667                                  
 25668                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25669                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 25670                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 25671                                  %if 0
 25672                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 25673                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25674                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25675                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25676                                  
 25677                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 25678                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 25679                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 25680                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25681                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25682                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25683                                  
 25684                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 25685                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25686                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25687                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25688                                  
 25689                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 25690                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 25691                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25692                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25693                                  
 25694                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 25695                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 25696                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?

 25903                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25904                                  ;
 25905                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25906                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25907                                  ;
 25908                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25909                                  ;
 25910                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25911                                  ;
 25912                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25913                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25914                                  
 25915                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25916                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25917 00001A2F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25918 00001A30 2EF606[D114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25919 00001A36 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25920                                  
 25921 00001A38 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25922 00001A39 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25923                                  
 25924                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25925 00001A3A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25926 00001A3B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25927                                  
 25928 00001A3D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25929 00001A3E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25930                                  
 25931                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25932 00001A3F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25933 00001A40 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26467

 26469                                  	;jz	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; no switch, no keyword (tm08)
 26470                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26471                                  	; cf=0
 26472 00001C32 7505                    	jnz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 26473 00001C34 C3                      	retn
 26474                                  
 26475                                  	;dec	si			;AN000; backup si for next call (tm08)
 26476                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off

 26500                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26501                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 26502                                  ;
 26503                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 26504                                  ;
 26505                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26506                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26507                                  ;
 26508                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 26509                                  ;**********************************************************************
 26510                                  
 26511                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 26512 00001C3B 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26513 00001C3C 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26514 00001C3D 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 26515 00001C3F 742C                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26516 00001C41 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 26517 00001C43 7428                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26518                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 26519 00001C45 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 26520 00001C47 7424                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26521                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 26522 00001C49 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 26523                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 26524 00001C4E 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26525 00001C50 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 26526 00001C52 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 26527                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26528 00001C56 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 26529                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26530 00001C59 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *
 26531 00001C5B 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 26532 00001C5F 740B                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 26533                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26534                                  	;;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 26535                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *
 26536 00001C61 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; 
 26537                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 26538 00001C64 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26539 00001C65 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 26540 00001C68 7403                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26541 00001C6A E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 26542                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26543                                  	; cx=0
 26544                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 26545                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 26546                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26547 00001C6C 41                      	inc	cx  ; zf=0  (cx=1) ; *
 26548                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 26549 00001C6D 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26550 00001C6E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26551 00001C6F C3                      	retn
 26552                                  
 26553                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26554                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26555                                  ;
 26556                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26557                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26558                                  ;	    blanks.
 26559                                  ;
 26560                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26561                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26562                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26563                                  ;
 26564                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26565                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26566                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26567                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26568                                  
 26569                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26570                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26571                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26572                                  
 26573                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26574 00001C70 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26575 00001C71 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26576 00001C72 2EC606[CB14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26577                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26578                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26579 00001C78 2E8026[D114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26580 00001C7E 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26581 00001C80 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26582                                  
 26583 00001C82 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26584 00001C84 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26585                                  
 26586 00001C86 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26587 00001C88 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26588                                  
 26589                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26590                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26591                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26592                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26593                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26594                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26595                                  %if 0
 26596                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26597                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26598                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26599                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26600                                  
 26601                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26602                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26603                                  
 26604                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26605                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26606                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26607                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26608                                  %endif
 26609                                  
 26610                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26611 00001C8A 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26612                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26613 00001C8F 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26614                                  
 26615                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26616 00001C91 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26617                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26618 00001C93 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26619                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26620                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26621                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26622                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26623 00001C97 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26624                                  
 26625 00001C99 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26626                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26627 00001C9C 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26628 00001C9D 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 26629 00001CA0 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26630                                  
 26631 00001CA2 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26632                                  
 26633                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26634                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26635                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26636                                  	; cx=0 here
 26637 00001CA4 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26638                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26639                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26640 00001CA5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26641 00001CA6 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26642 00001CA7 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26643                                  
 26644                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26645 00001CA8 2EA2[CB14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26646 00001CAC 2EF606[D114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26647 00001CB2 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26648                                  
 26649 00001CB4 2E800E[D114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26650                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26651                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26652 00001CBA 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26653 00001CBC EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26654                                  
 26655                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26656                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26657                                  ;
 26658                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26659                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26660                                  ;
 26661                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26662                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26663                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26664                                  ;
 26665                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26666                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26667                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26668                                  
 26669                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26670                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26671                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26672                                  ;
 26673                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26674                                  
 26675                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26676                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26677                                  
 26678                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26679                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26680                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26681                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26682 00001CBE BD[DA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26683                                  
 26684                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26685 00001CC1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26686 00001CC3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26687                                  
 26688                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26689 00001CC5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26690 00001CC7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26691                                  
 26692 00001CC9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26693                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26694                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26695 00001CCA C3                      	retn
 26696                                  
 26697                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26698                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26699                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26700                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26701                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26702                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26703                                  
 26704                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26705                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26706 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26707 00001CCD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26708                                  
 26709 00001CCF 2E800E[D114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26710                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26711                                  
 26712                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26713                                  	; cf=0
 26714                                  	;retn
 26715                                  
 26716                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26717                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26718                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26719 00001CD5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26720                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26721                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26722 00001CD6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26723                                  
 26724                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26725                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26726                                  ;
 26727                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26728                                  ;
 26729                                  ;  Input:
 26730                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26731                                  ;
 26732                                  ;  Output:
 26733                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26734                                  ;
 26735                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26736                                  ;
 26737                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26738                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26739                                  
 26740                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26741 00001CD7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26742 00001CD8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26743 00001CD9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26744                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26745                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26746                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26747 00001CDA 2E8B36[CE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26748 00001CDF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26749 00001CE1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26750 00001CE3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26751 00001CE4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26752 00001CE5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26753 00001CE6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26754 00001CE7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26755 00001CE8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26756 00001CE9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26757                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26758                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26759 00001CEA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26760 00001CEC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26761 00001CEF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26762                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26763 00001CF1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26764 00001CF3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26765 00001CF5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26766 00001CF6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26767 00001CF7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26768 00001CF8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26769 00001CF9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26770 00001CFA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26771 00001CFB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26772 00001CFC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26773                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26774 00001CFE 2E8936[CC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26775 00001D03 2E891E[CE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26776                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26777                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26778                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26779                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26780 00001D08 2EC536[CC14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26781                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26782 00001D0D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26783 00001D10 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26784 00001D12 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26785 00001D14 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26786 00001D16 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26787 00001D19 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26788 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26789 00001D1C EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26790                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26791 00001D1E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26792 00001D1F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26793                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26794 00001D20 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26795                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26796                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26797                                  	; cf=0
 26798                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26799                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 26800 00001D22 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26801 00001D23 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 26802 00001D24 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 26803 00001D25 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27370                                  
 27371                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27372                                  ;
 27373                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27374                                  ;
 27375                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27376                                  ;
 27377                                  ;   Modification log:
 27378                                  ;
 27379                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27380                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27381                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27382                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27383                                  ;
 27384                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27385                                  ;
 27386                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27387                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27388                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27389                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27390                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27391                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27392                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27393                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27394                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27395                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27396                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27397                                  ;
 27398                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27399                                  
 27400                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27401                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27402                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27403                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27404                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27405                                  
 27406                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27407                                  
 27408                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27409                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27410                                  
 27411                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27412                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27413                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27414                                  
 27415                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27416                                  ;
 27417                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27418                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27419                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27420                                  ;	           line.
 27421                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27422                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27423                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27424                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27425                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27426                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27427                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27428                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27429                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27430                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27431                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27432                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27433                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27434                                  ;	           for details).
 27435                                  
 27436 00001F25 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27437 00001F26 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27438 00001F27 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27439 00001F29 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27440 00001F2A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27441 00001F3A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27442 00001F5A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27443 00001F5B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27444 00001F5C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27445                                  
 27446                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27447                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27448                                  
 27449                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27450                                  
 27451                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022

 27579                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27580                                  ;
 27581                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27582                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27583                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27584                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27585                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27586                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27587                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27588                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27589                                  ;

 27591 00001FD9 8916[B614]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for

 27631 00001FFF 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27632 00002001 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars

 27635

 27641

 27646 0000200D AA                      	stosb

 27726 00002058 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 27727

 27729                                  
 27730                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27731 0000205E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 27732                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 27733                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 27734 00002060 8826[BA14]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 27735 00002064 8826[BD14]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 27736                                  
 27737 00002068 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 27738 0000206A 7448                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 27739                                  
 27740                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27741                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 27742                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27743                                  ;%if 0
 27744                                  
 27745                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27746                                  
 27747                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 27748                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 27749                                  
 27750 0000206C A2[B814]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 27751                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 27752 0000206F 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 27753                                  
 27754                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27755 00002071 3826[B914]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 27756                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 27757 00002075 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 27758                                  
 27759 00002077 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27760 00002078 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27761 0000207B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27762 0000207D E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27763 00002080 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27764 00002082 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27765 00002085 58                              pop     ax
 27766                                  ;
 27767                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27768                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27769                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27770                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27771                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27772                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27773                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27774                                  ;   spot.
 27775                                  ;
 27776                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27777                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27778                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27779                                  ;   retrieved.
 27780                                  ;
 27781 00002086 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27782 0000208B 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27783                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27784 0000208D F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27785 00002092 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27786 00002094 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27787 00002099 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27788                                  final:                                  ;
 27789 0000209B 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27790                                  not_final:                              ;
 27791                                  ;endif
 27792                                  
 27793                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27794                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27795                                  
 27796 0000209E 88C4                    	mov	ah,al

 27863                                  ;       but don't process them now.
