 27980                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27981                                  ;									      *
 27982                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27983                                  ;									      *
 27984                                  ; input :								      *
 27985                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27986                                  ; output:								      *
 27987                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27988                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27989                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27990                                  ;									      *
 27991                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27992                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27993                                  ; logic:								      *
 27994                                  ; {									      *
 27995                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27996                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27997                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27998                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27999                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 28000                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 28001                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 28002                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 28003                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 28004                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 28005                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 28006                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 28007                                  ;	};								      *
 28008                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 28009                                  ; };									      *
 28010                                  ;									      *
 28011                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28012                                  
 28013                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 28014                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 28015                                  tryb:
 28016 00002152 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'

 28019                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 28026                                  ;endif
 28027                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28028

 28038                                  	;mov	dx,cx

 28041 00002168 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 28042                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 28043                                  	;;jmp	short sr7

 28048 0000216A E9A606                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 28049                                  if7:
 28050 0000216D 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 28051 00002170 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 28052                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 28053 00002172 813E[711D][661D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x

 28103                                  ; break command
 28104                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28105                                  
 28106                                  ;****************************************************************************
 28107                                  ;									    *
 28108                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 28109                                  ;									    *
 28110                                  ; input :								    *
 28111                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 28112                                  ; output:								    *
 28113                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 28114                                  ;									    *
 28115                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 28116                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 28117                                  ; logic:								    *
 28118                                  ; {									    *
 28119                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 28120                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 28121                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 28122                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 28123                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 28124                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 28125                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 28126                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 28127                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 28128                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 28129                                  ;	};								    *
 28130                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 28131                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 28132                                  ; };									    *
 28133                                  ;									    *
 28134                                  ;****************************************************************************
 28135                                  
 28136                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 28137                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 28138                                  tryc:
 28139 000021B3 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 28140 000021B6 7539                    	jne	short trym
 28141                                  
 28142                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28143                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 28144                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28145                                  ;%if 0
 28146                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28147 000021B8 E8DE1E                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 28148 000021BB 7234                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 28149                                  ;endif
 28150                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28151                                  
 28152 000021BD BF[771D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 28153 000021C0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 28154                                  	; 03/01/2023
 28155                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 28156                                  do22:
 28157 000021C2 E81F07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 28158 000021C5 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 28159                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 28160                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 28161                                  	; 31/12/2022
 28162                                  ;sr22:
 28163                                  	;jmp	coff
 28164                                  	; 03/01/2023
 28165 000021C7 E94906                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 28166                                  if22:
 28167 000021CA 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 28168 000021CD 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 28169                                  
 28170                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 28171 000021CF 803E[701D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 28172 000021D4 7507                    	jne	short if26
 28173                                  
 28174 000021D6 C606[9C1D]01            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],1	; turn it on
 28175                                  	;jmp	short en26
 28176                                  	; 31/12/2022

 28180                                  en26:

 28182                                  en22:
 28183 000021E4 B433                    	mov	ah,SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING ; if we don't have any parse error.

 28186 000021EC CD21                    	int	21h
 28187                                  	; 31/12/2022

 28189                                  	; 03/01/2023

 29173                                  ;CheckDoubleSpace:
 29174                                  ;;;;	ifdef	dblspace_hooks
 29175                                  ;
 29176                                  ;;	Now check for two special MagicDrv cases:
 29177                                  ;;
 29178                                  ;;       a) the last driver load was MagicDrv final placement:
 29179                                  ;;	   -> add number of MagicDrv reserved drives to drivenumber
 29180                                  ;;
 29181                                  ;;       b) MagicDrv is currently in temporary home:
 29182                                  ;;          -> call it to give it a chance to mount and shuffle drives
 29183                                  ;
 29184                                  ;	cmp	byte [cs:MagicHomeFlag],0 ; already home?
 29185                                  ;	jnz	short no_more_magic_calls ;  nothing more to do if so
 29186                                  ;
 29187                                  ;;	Now inquire of driver whether it is present, and final located
 29188                                  ;
 29189                                  ;	mov	ax,multMagicdrv ; 4A11h
 29190                                  ;	mov	bx,MD_VERSION ; 0
 29191                                  ;	int	2fh			; ch = number of MagicDrv drive letters
 29192                                  ;	or	ax,ax			; is it there?
 29193                                  ;	jnz	short no_more_magic_calls ; done if not
 29194                                  ;
 29195                                  ;	test	dx,8000h		; is it final placed?
 29196                                  ;	jnz	short magic_not_yet_home ;  skip if not
 29197                                  ;
 29198                                  ;;	Okay, now the driver is final placed!  Set the flag so we
 29199                                  ;;	don't keep checking it, and add its number of drive letters
 29200                                  ;;	to drivenumber.

 29715                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29716                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29717                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29718                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29719                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29720                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29721                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29722                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29723                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29724                                  
 29725                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29726                                  ;									  *
 29727                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29728                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29729                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29730                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29731                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29732                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29733                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29734                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29735                                  ; input :								  *
 29736                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29737                                  ; output:								  *
 29738                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29739                                  ;									  *
 29740                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29741                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29742                                  ; logic:								  *
 29743                                  ; {									  *
 29744                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29745                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29746                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29747                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29748                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29749                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29750                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29751                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29752                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29753                                  ;	     }								  *
 29754                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29755                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29756                                  ;	};								  *
 29757                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29758                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29759                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29760                                  ; };									  *

 30510                                  
 30511                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30512                                  ;set up registers for sysparse

 30514                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 30515                                  ;
 30516                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30517                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30518                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30519                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30520                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30521                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30522                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30523                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30524                                  ;	 procedure.
 30525                                  ;	ax - exit code
 30526                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 30527                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 30528                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand

 30874                                  ;
 30875                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30876                                  ;
 30877                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30878                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30879                                  ;
 30880                                  ;	Output : none
 30881                                  ;
 30882                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30883                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30884                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30885                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30886                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30887                                  ;
 30888                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30889                                  
 30890                                  LieInt12Mem:
 30891                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30892                                  	; ds = cs
 30893 00002989 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 30894                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 30895                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30896 0000298C E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30897 0000298F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30898                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30899                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30900                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30901                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 30902                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30903                                  	; ds = cs
 30904 00002991 803E[7B1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30905 00002996 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30906 00002998 A1[611F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30907                                  lim_set:
 30908                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30909                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30910                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30911                                  ;limx:
 30912                                  	;retn
 30913                                  	
 30914                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 30915                                  
 30916                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30917                                  ;
 30918                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30919                                  ;
 30920                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30921                                  ;	Output : none
 30922                                  ;
 30923                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30924                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30925                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30926                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30927                                  ;
 30928                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30929                                  
 30930                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30931                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30932 0000299B 1E                      	push	ds
 30933 0000299C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30934 0000299F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30935 000029A1 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30936 000029A5 2E891E[7F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30937 000029AA B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30938 000029AC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30939 000029AE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30940 000029B1 2EC606[7E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30941 000029B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 30942                                  ;limx:
 30943 000029B8 C3                      	retn
 30944                                  
 30945                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30946                                  ;
 30947                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30948                                  ;
 30949                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30950                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30951                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30952                                  ;
 30953                                  ;	Output : none
 30954                                  ;
 30955                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30956                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30957                                  ;
 30958                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30959                                  
 30960                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30961                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30962                                  	; ds = cs
 30963 000029B9 803E[7E1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30964                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 30965                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30966                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30967 000029BE 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30968                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30969 000029C0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30970 000029C3 8826[7E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30971                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30972                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30973 000029C7 1E                      	push	ds
 30974                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30975 000029C8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30976 000029CA 2EA1[7F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 30977 000029CE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 30978 000029D1 1F                      	pop	ds
 30979                                  timx:
 30980 000029D2 C3                      	retn

 31031                                  ;%if 0

 31033                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31034                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31035                                  
 31036                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 31037                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 31038                                  
 31039                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31040                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 31041                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31042                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31043                                  
 31044                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31045                                  ;
 31046                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 31047                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 31048                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 31049                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 31050                                  ;
 31051                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 31052                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 31053                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 31054                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 31055                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 31056                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 31057                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 31058                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 31059                                  ; available during the load.
 31060                                  ;
 31061                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 31062                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 31063                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 31064                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 31065                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 31066                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 31067                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 31068                                  ;
 31069                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 31070                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 31071                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 31072                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 31073                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 31074                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 31075                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 31076                                  ;
 31077                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31078                                  
 31079                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 31080                                  
 31081                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 31082                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 31083                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 31084                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 31085                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 31086                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 31087                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 31088                                  
 31089                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 31090                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 31091                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 31092                                  
 31093                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31094                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 31095                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31096                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 31097                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 31098                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 31099                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31100                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31101                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 31102                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 31103                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31104                                  
 31105                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31106                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31107                                  
 31108                                  InitVar:
 31109                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31110                                  	; ds = cs
 31111                                  
 31112                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 31113                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31114                                  	;push	ax
 31115                                  	;push	cx
 31116                                  	;push	di
 31117 000029FD 06                      	push	es
 31118                                  
 31119                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 31120 000029FE 0E                      	push	cs
 31121 000029FF 07                      	pop	es
 31122                                  
 31123 00002A00 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31124                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31125                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31126                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31127                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31128                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31129                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 31130                                  
 31131                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31132                                  	; ds = cs
 31133 00002A02 A2[261F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31134 00002A05 A2[251F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31135 00002A08 A3[271F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31136 00002A0B C606[291F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31137                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31138 00002A10 A2[5C1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 31139                                  
 31140 00002A13 FC                      	cld
 31141                                  
 31142 00002A14 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 31143 00002A17 BF[2A1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 31144 00002A1A F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 31145                                  
 31146                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 31147                                  	; 01/01/2033
 31148 00002A1C B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 31149 00002A1E BF[3A1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 31150 00002A21 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 31151                                  
 31152                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 31153                                  
 31154                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 31155 00002A23 07                      	pop	es
 31156                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31157                                  	;pop	di
 31158                                  	;pop	cx
 31159                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 31160                                  
 31161 00002A24 C3                      	retn
 31162                                  
 31163                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31164                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 31165                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31166                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 31167                                  ; EXIT    : None
 31168                                  ; ERROR   : None
 31169                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31170                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31171                                  
 31172                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31173                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 31174                                  FixMem:
 31175                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31176                                  	;push	ax
 31177                                  	;push	bx
 31178                                  	;push	cx
 31179                                  	;push	dx
 31180 00002A25 06                      	push	es
 31181                                  
 31182 00002A26 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 31183                                  
 31184 00002A29 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 31185 00002A2C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 31186                                  
 31187 00002A2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 31188                                  
 31189                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 31190                                  
 31191 00002A30 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 31192 00002A32 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 31193 00002A34 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 31194                                  
 31195                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31196                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 31197                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 31198                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31199                                  
 31200 00002A35 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop

 31306                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31307                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 31308                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 31309                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31310                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 31311                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 31312                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 31313                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31314                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31315                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 31316                                  ;
 31317                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 31318                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 31319                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31320                                  ;
 31321                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 31322                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 31323                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 31324                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 31325                                  ;
 31326                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 31327                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 31328                                  ;
 31329                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31330                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 31331                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 31332                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 31333                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 31334                                  ;     lh
 31335                                  ;     /l
 31336                                  ;     1
 31337                                  ;     1000
 31338                                  ;     2
 31339                                  ;     print
 31340                                  ;     /d
 31341                                  ;     :lpt2
 31342                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31343                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31344                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31345                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31346                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31347                                  ; for:
 31348                                  ;    Each /L
 31349                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31350                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31351                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31352                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31353                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31354                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31355                                  
 31356                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31357                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31358                                  
 31359                                  ParseVar:
 31360                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31361                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31362                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31363 00002A8F 1E                      	push	ds
 31364 00002A90 06                      	push	es
 31365                                  
 31366 00002A91 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31367 00002A92 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31368 00002A93 FC                      	cld
 31369                                  
 31370                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31371                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31372                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31373                                  
 31374 00002A94 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31375 00002A95 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31376 00002A98 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31377                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31378 00002A9A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31379 00002A9C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31380                                  
 31381 00002A9E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31382 00002A9F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31383 00002AA0 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31384                                  
 31385 00002AA2 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31386                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31387 00002AA3 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31388                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31389 00002AA5 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31390 00002AA7 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31391                                  
 31392                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31393 00002AA9 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31394                                  
 31395                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31396                                  	;
 31397                                  	;push	es
 31398                                  	;push	cs
 31399                                  	;pop	es
 31400                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31401                                  	;pop	es
 31402                                  
 31403 00002AAE 2EC606[261F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31404                                  
 31405 00002AB4 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31406                                  
 31407                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31408 00002AB6 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 31409 00002AB8 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 31410                                  
 31411                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31412 00002ABA 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31413                                  
 31414 00002ABF E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31415 00002AC2 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31416                                  
 31417 00002AC4 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31418 00002AC5 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31419                                  
 31420                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31421 00002AC7 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31422 00002ACA 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31423 00002ACB 4E                      	dec	si
 31424 00002ACC F9                      	stc
 31425                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31426 00002ACD 07                      	pop	es
 31427 00002ACE 1F                      	pop	ds
 31428                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31429                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31430 00002ACF C3                      	retn
 31431                                  
 31432                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31433                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31434                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31435                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31436                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31437                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31438                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31439                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31440                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31441                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31442                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 31443                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31444                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31445                                  
 31446                                  parseL:
 31447 00002AD0 AC                      	lodsb
 31448 00002AD1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31449 00002AD3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31450                                  
 31451                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31452                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31453                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31454                                  
 31455 00002AD5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31456 00002AD8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31457 00002ADA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31458

 31460 00002ADF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31461 00002AE2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31462                                  
 31463                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31464 00002AE4 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31465                                  
 31466 00002AE9 AC                      	lodsb
 31467 00002AEA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31468 00002AEC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31469                                  
 31470 00002AEE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31471 00002AF1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31472                                  
 31473 00002AF3 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31474 00002AF6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31475                                  
 31476                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31477 00002AF8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31478 00002AFA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31479                                  
 31480 00002AFC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31481 00002AFE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31482                                  
 31483                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31484                                  
 31485 00002B00 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31486 00002B03 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31487                                  
 31488 00002B05 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31489                                  
 31490 00002B08 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31491                                  
 31492                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31493 00002B0B 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31494                                  
 31495 00002B10 AC                      	lodsb
 31496 00002B11 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31497 00002B13 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31498                                  
 31499 00002B15 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31500 00002B18 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31501                                  
 31502 00002B1A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31503 00002B1D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31504                                  
 31505                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31506 00002B1F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31507 00002B21 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31508                                  plE1:	
 31509                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31510 00002B23 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31511 00002B26 4E                      	dec	si

 31554                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31555                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31556                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31557                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31558                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31559                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31560                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31561                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31562                                  
 31563                                  isEOL:
 31564 00002B2F 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 31565 00002B31 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31566 00002B33 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31567 00002B35 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31568 00002B37 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31569                                  ieX:	
 31570 00002B39 C3                      	retn
 31571                                  
 31572                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31573                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 31574                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31575                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31576                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31577                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31578                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31579                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31580                                  
 31581                                  isWhite:

 31583 00002B3C 7406                    	je	short iwX

 31585 00002B40 7402                    	je	short iwX

 31587                                  iwX:	
 31588 00002B44 C3                      	retn

 31641                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31642                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31643                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31644                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31645                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31646                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31647                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31648                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31649                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31650                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31651                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31652                                  
 31653                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31654                                  stowUMB:
 31655 00002B58 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31656 00002B5A 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31657 00002B5C F9                      	stc
 31658 00002B5D C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 31659                                  su10:	
 31660                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31661                                  	;push	bx
 31662                                  	;push	di
 31663                                  	;push	si
 31664                                  	;push	ds
 31665                                  	;push	es
 31666                                  	;push	cs
 31667                                  	;pop	es
 31668                                  	;push	cs
 31669                                  	;pop	ds
 31670                                  
 31671                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31672                                  	; ds <> cs
 31673                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31674 00002B5E 2E803E[291F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31675                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31676 00002B64 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31677 00002B66 2EA2[291F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31678                                  
 31679                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31680                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31681                                  	;jne	short su20
 31682                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31683                                  su20:	
 31684 00002B6A 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31685 00002B6C 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 31686                                  
 31687                                  	;mov	bl,al
 31688                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 31689                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 31690                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31691 00002B6E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 31692 00002B70 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 31693 00002B72 B001                    	mov	al,1
 31694                                  
 31695                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31696                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31697 00002B74 2E8687[2A1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31698                                  
 31699                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 31700                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 31701                                  	;
 31702                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 31703                                  	
 31704                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31705 00002B79 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 31706 00002B7B F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 31707                                  su30:	
 31708                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31709                                  	;pop	es
 31710                                  	;pop	ds
 31711                                  	;pop	si
 31712                                  	;pop	di
 31713                                  	;pop	bx
 31714 00002B7C C3                      	retn
 31715                                  
 31716                                  ; 08/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 31717                                  %if 0

 31753                                  
 31754                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31755                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 31756                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 31757                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 31758                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 31759                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31760                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 31761                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 31762                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 31763                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 31764                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31765                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31766                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31767                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31768                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31769                                  
 31770                                  gnradix:
 31771 00002B7D 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 31772                                  
 31773                                  toDigit:
 31774 00002B7F 2E833E[7D2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31775 00002B85 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 31776                                  
 31777                                  toDigit_hex:
 31778 00002B87 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 31779 00002B8A 7209                    	jb	short td10
 31780 00002B8C 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 31781 00002B8F 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 31782 00002B91 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 31783                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31784 00002B94 C3                      	retn
 31785                                  td10:	
 31786 00002B95 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 31787 00002B98 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 31788 00002B9A 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 31789 00002B9D 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 31790 00002B9F 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 31791                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31792 00002BA2 C3                      	retn
 31793                                  toDigit_dec:
 31794                                  td20:	
 31795 00002BA3 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 31796                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 31797 00002BA6 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 31798 00002BA8 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 31799 00002BAB 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 31800 00002BAD 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 31801                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31802 00002BB0 C3                      	retn
 31803                                  tdE:	
 31804 00002BB1 F9                      	stc
 31805                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 31806 00002BB2 C3                      	retn
 31807                                  
 31808                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31809                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 31810                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31811                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 31812                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 31813                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 31814                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 31815                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31816                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31817                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31818                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31819                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31820                                  
 31821                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31822                                  
 31823                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31824                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 31825                                  
 31826                                  GetXNum:
 31827                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 31828                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31829                                  	;push	bx
 31830 00002BB3 51                      	push	cx ; *
 31831                                  	;push	ds
 31832                                  
 31833 00002BB4 FC                      	cld
 31834 00002BB5 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31835 00002BB7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31836 00002BB9 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 31837 00002BBB 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 31838                                  
 31839 00002BBD 2EC706[7D2B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 31840                                  
 31841 00002BC4 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 31842                                  	;call	toDigit
 31843 00002BC7 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 31844                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 31845                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31846 00002BCA 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 31847                                  
 31848 00002BCC 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 31849 00002BCE 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 31850 00002BD0 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 31851 00002BD4 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 31852 00002BD7 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 31853 00002BD9 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 31854 00002BDC 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 31855                                  
 31856                                  gxn10:	
 31857 00002BDE 2EC706[7D2B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 31858 00002BE5 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 31859 00002BE6 46                      	inc	si
 31860                                  
 31861                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31862                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 31863                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 31864                                  ;        BX    = 0
 31865                                  ;        CH    = 0
 31866                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31867                                  
 31868                                  gxn20:	
 31869 00002BE7 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 31870 00002BEA 46                      	inc	si
 31871                                  
 31872 00002BEB E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 31873 00002BEE 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 31874                                  
 31875 00002BF0 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31876 00002BF3 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31877                                  
 31878 00002BF5 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31879 00002BF7 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 31880                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31881                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31882 00002BF9 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 31883                                  gxnE:	
 31884                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31885 00002BFB EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31886                                  gxnQ:	
 31887 00002BFD 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31888 00002BFE F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31889                                  gxnX:	
 31890                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31891                                  	;pop	ds
 31892 00002BFF 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31893                                  	;pop	bx
 31894 00002C00 C3                      	retn
 31895                                  
 31896                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31897                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31898                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31899                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31900                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31901                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31902                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31903                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31904                                  
 31905                                  mul32:
 31906 00002C01 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31907 00002C02 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31908 00002C04 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31909 00002C09 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31910                                  
 31911 00002C0B 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31912 00002C0D 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31913                                  
 31914 00002C0E 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31915 00002C10 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31916 00002C15 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31917 00002C17 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31918 00002C19 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31919 00002C1B C3                      	retn
 31920                                  m32E:	
 31921 00002C1C 58                      	pop	ax
 31922 00002C1D C3                      	retn
 31923                                  
 31924                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31925                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 31926                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31927                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 31928                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 31929                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31930                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31931                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31932                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 31933                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 31934                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31935                                  
 31936                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31937                                  toPara:
 31938 00002C1E 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 31939                                  
 31940 00002C1F B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 31941 00002C21 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 31942 00002C23 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31943 00002C24 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 31944 00002C26 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 31945 00002C28 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 31946                                  
 31947 00002C2A 59                      	pop	cx
 31948 00002C2B C3                      	retn

 31950                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31951                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 31952                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31953                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 31954                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 31955                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 31956                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31957                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31958                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 31959                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 31960                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 31961                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 31962                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31963                                  
 31964                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31965                                  UmbHead:
 31966                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 31967                                  
 31968                                  	;push	si ; ?
 31969                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 31970                                  	;push	es
 31971                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 31972                                  
 31973                                  	; 09/04/2019
 31974                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 31975                                  
 31976 00002C2C B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 31977 00002C2E CD21                    	int	21h
 31978                                  
 31979 00002C30 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 31980                                  	
 31981                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31982 00002C34 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31983 00002C37 F5                      	cmc
 31984                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 31985 00002C38 C3                      	retn
 31986

 31989                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh

 31993                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX

 31995                                  ;	retn

 32008                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32009                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 32010                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)

 32021                                  	;;je	short ism10
 32022                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 32023                                  	;jne	short ismX
 32024 00002C39 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 32025 00002C3F 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 32026                                  ism10:	
 32027                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 32028                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 32029 00002C41 26813E08005343          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
